properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A group of employees (article implies they are managers) of the Directorate General of Revenue of the Eastern Province (DGRPO) prevented the installation of a new leadership structure by burning tires and throwing projectiles at the replacements, outside the DGRPO offices. Police arrived and fired shots into the air to disperse the rioters.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Civil society groups organized a protest march against government measures which have blocked broadcast of a film about Dr. Mukwege, who works to help women affected by sexual assault/rape.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
properties.NOTES: The Secretary-General of the MLC says that her son was picked up by intelligence officers at the Congo Protestant University and she has not heard from him since.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Marungu)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: An anti-FDLR militia led by a man named Marungu attacked an FDLR position in Kanyavyunza in the Itala grouping, near Miriki, killing an FDLR captain and his bodyguard.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Cmdt La Fontaine)
properties.NOTES: Lafontaine militiamen have occupied several villages in the Musindi area of Lubero territory over the last 2 weeks.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
properties.NOTES: NDC-Cheka militiamen have occupied about 10 villages in the Lubero area in the past 2 weeks.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Associated Press International
properties.NOTES: After violence broke out at a major opposition rally between the demonstrators and a small group of youths armed with sticks and stones, police arrived to disperse the demonstrators using batons.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Associated Press International; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: At least 3 people were injured at a rally organized by the main opposition parties against President Kabila's possible bid for a third term. The 2,000 attendants were attacked by about 15 young men armed with sticks and stones (who were allegedly hired by the ruling party, the PPRD). Some of the youths among the protesters retaliated against their attackers and beat one of them.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 3 people, a shopkeeper and his 2 daughters, were shot dead by suspected ADF rebels in Kokola village.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Local civil society organizations have reported that ADF rebels killed 27 people during September (10 of these coded in other events) and kidnapped at least 20.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
properties.NOTES: Local residents say that NDC-Cheka fighters have set up camp in the Majengo region near Goma in search of FDLR rebels. It is not clear what their purpose is in looking for them.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Cmdt La Fontaine)
properties.NOTES: Local residents say that Mayi Mayi Lafontaine militiamen are in control of the Mbwavinywa region.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Former agents of the Urban Transport Company Congo (STUCCO) organized a sit-in to demand salary arrears going back years.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A demonstration against a potential third term for President Kabila, organized by an opposition umbrella organization "Dynamic", was diserpsed violently by the police.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighting between FARDC soldiers and APCLS forces between Sept.19-23 has displaced thousands of villagers in the Kashebere area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A female rebel leader, Cynthia Sisawa, the leader of the Sisawa Mayi Mayi group, surrendered in the Shabunda to the government.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels attacked Kibirizi township, looted it and ravaged properties in the area. Residents have sinced called for army reinforcements to ensure security in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighting between FARDC soldiers and APCLS forces between Sept.19-23 has displaced thousands of villagers in the Kashebere area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: According to a report by the UN Office of Human Rights, Congolese soldiers raped 14 women during operations against the Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia in the Kalehe area between Sept.20-22. There were also reports of torture and extortion.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked and looted villages in the Irumu area, including in the Aveba Mdogo, Bunga, Alingba, Mbize, Ndugu, and Zitono areas.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked and looted villages in the Irumu area, including in the Aveba Mdogo, Bunga, Alingba, Mbize, Ndugu, and Zitono areas. The militiamen allegedly tortured villagers during these raids.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: ADF forces ambushed FARDC soldiers near Kokola.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighting between FARDC soldiers and APCLS forces between Sept.19-23 has displaced thousands of villagers in the Kashebere area.

properties.NOTES: According to a report by the UN Office of Human Rights, Congolese soldiers raped 14 women during operations against the Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia in the Kalehe area between Sept.20-22. There were also reports of torture and extortion.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked the villages of Lusele-Karera and Tomombo in the Balomotwa sector of the Mitwaba area. They fired into the air, looted the villages, and burned the house before escaping.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighting between FARDC soldiers and APCLS forces between Sept.19-23 has displaced thousands of villagers in the Kashebere area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The former governor of Kasai Oriental staged a march in support of President Joseph Kabila in Mbuji-Mayi.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: According to a report by the UN Office of Human Rights, Congolese soldiers raped 14 women during operations against the Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia in the Kalehe area between Sept.20-22. There were also reports of torture and extortion.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: During ongoing operations by FARDC soldiers and the APCLS, the commander of a MONUSCO operational base was wounded during a patrol.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC and ADF forces clashed in the Mayangose area in Virunga National Park.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighting between FARDC soldiers and APCLS forces between Sept.19-23 has displaced thousands of villagers in the Kashebere area. At least 1 militia officer was captured during the fighting on Septe.23.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: FARDC and APCLS forces clashed in the Kashebere area.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 prisoners were killed and a third seriously injured during a mass escape attempt from Kasaji prison where prisoners overwhelmed their captors and forced their way out despite warning shots being fired. 13 prisoners managed to escape out of a total of 29.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: At least 3 FARDC soldiers and 3 soldiers' wives were killed during an assault by an unidentified armed group on a FARDC camp in the Rumangabo area. The attackers also stole heavy weapons.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyumba-Isha)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Nyumba-Isha Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped a local security chief in the Kabangu area of Manono territory. He was allegedly captured due to atrocities he committed against the Luba people in the Mambwe area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed and 2 women raped, as well as others injured, during an attack on the town of Makangalo in the Mambasa area by Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen. The militiamen fled before authorities arrived.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have reoccupied positons vacated voluntarily by APCLS fighters in the Kashebere area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The governor of Maniema staged a march in support of President Joseph Kabila in the context of opposition to his proposed term limit amendment by the G7 political parties group.

properties.ACTOR1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua General News Service
properties.NOTES: The governments of the DR-Congo and Rwanda have allegedly signed an agreement which allows Rwandan soldiers to enter the DR-Congo to hunt FDLR rebels. The agreement also committed both countries to greater cooperation and coordination between their militaries and intelligence services.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: 10 people were kidnapped by LRA rebels who arrived in the village firing their weapons in the air before plundering granaries and looting the village.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 11 soldiers and 2 civilians were killed when a Trust Merchant Bank (TMB) convoy carrying around $40,000 in pay for civil servants was attacked in the Uvira area by Mayi Mayi militiamen. 2 soldiers and 4 civilians were also seriously injured in the attack.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Youth in Goma engaged in a march for peace to mark the World Day of Peace which occurred on Sept.21.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A Congolese National Police officer was killed in an attack by an unidenified armed group on a police position.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Cmdt La Fontaine)
properties.NOTES: Lafontaine militiamen looted livestock from farmers in Karambi village in the Lubeor area.

properties.ACTOR1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The DR-Congo closed its border with CAR following days of violence in Bangui.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked Alingba village and other areas in the Aveba territory. They seriously injured at least one person and ransacked several houses, forcing many to flee the area.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
properties.NOTES: 4 artisanal miners were kidnapped by NDC-Cheka militiamen in the Musindi area of Lubero territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A hundred people, including government officials and private citizens, marched to show support for President Kabila in Beni.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: About a dozen people were kidnapped off mini-busses by an unidentified armed group in the Busendo area of Rutshuru.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Members of the Presidential Majority (MP) organized a march in support of President Kabila in Kikwit.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A man was shot dead by an unidentified gunmen in the Mbau area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.NOTES: A FARDC intelligence office allegedly tortured a man to death in Ituri after he was accused of owning a weapon.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked the Androzo village in Ituri, looting the area and injuring at least one man with gunfire.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC and ADF forces have clashed between Oct.5-7. 14 ADF rebels are reported to have been killed over 3 days of fighting between Oct.5-7.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Le Potentiel (Kinshasa); Agence France Presse
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO airstrikes have been launched in the Pinga area, in coordination with ground operations by FARDC, targeting the NDC. They claim to have killed 1 member of an armed group, and injured at least 4 others, and to have not caused any civilian casualties. Other sources claimed 4-5 civilians had been killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Members of the Presidential Majority (MP) organized a march in support of President Kabila in Kongolo. The march included hundreds of political party members, supporters and other sympathizers.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Villagers in the Pinga area have engaged in dead city protests against an alleged MONUSCO airstrike that resulting in civilian casualties.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Over 2,000 people have been displaced due to actions by the National Police in Bongoy (lat/longs not available) in Tshuapa territory. The police have allegedly carried out a large number of arbitrary arrests in order to protect a woman accused of witchcraft and her family. Police allegedly burnt dozens of homes after they were injured by rioting village youth who wanted to lynch the witch.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers and ADF rebels clashed in the forests northeast of Eringeti in Beni territory. The ADF rebels allegedly ambushed the FARDC soldiers. 14 ADF rebels are reported to have been killed over 3 days of fighting between Oct.5-7.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO airstrikes have continued in the Pinga area, targeting the NDC.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Villagers in the Pinga area continued to engage in dead city protests against an alleged MONUSCO airstrike that resulting in civilian casualties.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Dominique)
properties.NOTES: A militia group led by Dominique attacked Bukombo, Mashange and Tisa villages (coordinates not available for 2 of the villages, coded at Masisi, geoprecision 2), killing at least 6 civilians.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Dominique)
properties.NOTES: A militia group led by Dominique attacked Bukombo, Mashange and Tisa villages (coordinates not available for 2 of the villages, coded at Masisi, geoprecision 2), killing at least 6 civilians.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After FARDC marines arrested Rwandan fishermen for allegedly violating the DR-Congo's territorial waters, a speedboat of the Rwandan marines crossed the border and attacked the FARDC marines, leading to an RDF captain killed and 2 soldiers injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC and ADF forces have clashed between Oct.5-7. 14 ADF rebels are reported to have been killed over 3 days of fighting between Oct.5-7.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC and FRPI forces clashed in the Zitono area of Ituri, leading to 3 militiamen and 1 soldier killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Following allegedly arbitrary arrests by police to protect a woman accused of witchcraft, clashes broke out between the police and youths who wanted to lynch the woman. Dozens of homes were burned during the violence.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Shetani)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police arrested the head of the Mayi Mayi Shetani group in the Oicha area in a clinic after he was turned in by local residents.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels raided the town of Kamade, "molesting" many of the residents of the town and kidnapping at least 4 to help them transport looted goods before releasing them.

properties.ACTOR1: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Luba and Pygmy communities in the Nyemba Mukebo area have agreed to end the ongoing conflict between them, following the installation of a conflict resolution committee composed of local authorities last week.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Guards of Garamba National Park
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: A 10-man patrol team in Garamba was attacked by poachers who outnumbered them, believed to include SPLA and/or LRA members, killing 3 park guards and a FARDC soldier.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers attacked an unidentified armed group which had taken some people traveling by car between Bunia-Kaseny hostage, freeing the hostages after opening fire on the unidentified gunmen.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change
properties.NOTES: Lucha (Fight for change) activists protested outside the MONUSCO offices to demand an end to human rights abuses by FDLR. They also protested against any potential collaboration between the DR-Congo and Rwanda's armies.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa militia leader surrendered along with 20 of his men in Shabunda.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: An unidentified armed group took the passengers of several cars traveling on the Bunia-Kaseny road hostage during an ambush on their vehicles.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Dominique)
properties.NOTES: "A militia group under the command of a certain Dominique has been reported to be in control of a large number of villages in Walikale Territory"

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Another Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa militia leader, self-proclaimed Gen. Kabe Sanga, surrendered along with 28 of his men in Shabunda. They also brought with them various pieces of military hardware, including machine guns and rocket launchers.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The ADF target FARD positions in Tenambo, Tungudu, Matondo, and Makoko villages in the Oicha area. During these attacks the ADF also perposefully target civilians resulting in 8 fatalities.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Muti-Kavumu raised barricades to protest alleged roberries carried out by police and military members in their area. A clash broke out when the police attempted to dismantle the barricades, including gunfire. A dozen demonstrators were arrested by police and arrested a few hours later.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: At least 8 civilians were killed and at least 1 injured during three simultaneous attacks by the ADF on FARDC positions in Tenambo, Tungudu, Matondo, and Makoko villages in the Oicha area.

properties.ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: IDPs/Refugees (Central African Republic)
properties.NOTES: Anti-Balaka forces raided into DR-Congo in the Mobayi-Mbongo area, where they "tortured and looted" the refugees in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
properties.NOTES: A clash was reported between NDC-C fighters and a coalition of Lafontaine Mayi Mayi militiamen and FDLR rude allies in Lubero territory, resulting in 3 Lafontaine militiamen killed, 35 houses torched, and 4 civilians suspected of collaboration with the FDLR captured.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Dozens of civilians (coded as 12) were found killed in Mamiki village in the Beni area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Werrason)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers and Mayi Mayi coalition led by Manu and Werrason clashed in the Mambasa territory of Ituri, leading to 1 militiaman killed and 3 wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: M23: March 23 Movement
properties.NOTES: The CEPADHO, a civil society organization based in North Kivu, claim to have witnessed several hundred former M23 rebels joining the ADF in the Oicha area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A dozen unidentified armed men broke into the home of a RCDN leader, terrorized her family, and looted the place before leaving a message to not make trouble before leaving.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 4 people were killed during an ADF attack on FARDC positions in Oicha, allegedly to loot ammunition and food. At least 2 soldiers were injured.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Fighting between ADF rebels and FARDC soldiers continued in the Oicha area. A military spokesman said that the rebels had taken losses and confirmed civilian casualties but did quote specific fatality numbers (coded as 10).

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders
properties.NOTES: Militiamen of the FRPI robbed and assaulted four members of MSF.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Students and teachers of Gbadolite Presidential College staged a peaceful march yesterday against arrests and alleged mistreatment by Congolese national police.

properties.ACTOR1: Kumu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Zimba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed in a conflict which began on Oct.21 between the Kumu community in the Lubutu area and the Zimba community in the Kasongo area, both in Maniema territory. 12 people have also been injured and more than sixty households, and a dozen fish ponds, have been destroyed.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 3 bodies were found in Kamakombu, and they are believed to have been killed by machetes. ADF rebels are suspected.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A group of unidentified armed men intercepted a mini-bus in the Kahunga area. They killed a young man, and kidnapped 3 others.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Catholic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A group of unidentified armed men intercepted a vehicle of the Kanyabayonga Catholic parish, killing 2 people and kidnapping others.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: The LRA engaged in attacks in the Niangara area.

properties.NOTES: Between Oct.24-25, FARDC and ADF forces exchanged heavy weapons fire in the Beni and Mbau areas as they competed over positions around the villages of Makembi, Jerico and Chuchubo (or Nadwi).

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Students at the University of Kisangani (UNIKIS) barricaded the main road between downtown and the Plateau district to protest against a general power outage. They also set fire to two buildings and blocked a highway with trees stumps and rocks.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 600 ex-combatants (the groups they were from was not reported) who protested against poor living conditions on a Kamina military base where they had been stationed for 2 years while they waited to be reintegrated, left the base after the protest and set up a headquarters in the Lukulwe locality 8km from Kamina. They later agreed to return to the Kamina military base.

properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Xinhua General News Service; Radio Okapi
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels looted houses and raped at least 2 women during a battle with FARDC.

properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Xinhua General News Service; Radio Okapi
properties.NOTES: 4 ADF rebels and 2 FARDC soldiers were killed, and 3 soldiers injured, during heavy fighting between Oct.26-27 in and around several villages, including Makembi, Jerico and Chuchubo (or Nadwi) in the Beni and Mbau areas, which they also took control of. During the violence ADF rebels also looted houses and raped at least 2 women. One source had the number of fatalities as high as 30 (19 ADF and 11 FARDC).

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Xinhua General News Service; Radio Okapi
properties.NOTES: 4 ADF rebels and 2 FARDC soldiers were killed, and 3 soldiers injured, during heavy fighting between Oct.26-27 in and around several villages, including Makembi, Jerico and Chuchubo (or Nadwi) in the Beni and Mbau areas, which they also took control of. During the violence ADF rebels also looted houses and raped at least 2 women. One source had the number of fatalities as high as 30 (19 ADF and 11 FARDC).

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Werrason)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers and Mayi Mayi coalition led by Manu and Werrason clashed in the Mambasa territory of Ituri, leading to 4 dead and 1 injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A dead city protest was organized between Oct.26-28 to denounce the insecurity of National Road #4 after 10 civilians were killed and several others kidnapped in the area over the past 2 weeks.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers caused panic in Walikale after they fired into the air to express their anger about the murder of one of their colleagues who was standing guard over their armoury. 5 of the soldiers who engaged in the aerial firing were arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed during an attack by 20 FRPI militiamen in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi. 1 person was killed and 2 raped in Bunga specifically. The militiamen looted several house and fired into the air as they raided the areas.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed during an attack by 20 FRPI militiamen in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi. 1 person was killed and 2 raped in Bunga specifically. The militiamen looted several house and fired into the air as they raided the areas.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A "judicial defender" was allegedly assaulted by member of the Kamina military garrison after being detained for a few hours.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Bakata Katanga)
properties.NOTES: Bakata Katanga Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked the Tomombo area near Kitobo, injuring 3 people with gunfire and assaulting one woman.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: A group of armed men, believed to include SPLA and/or LRA members, attacked an anti-poaching patrol, killing one ranger and 2 Congolese soldiers at close range.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 50 "judicial defenders" organized a march in Kamina to protest against an assault which occurred on one of their colleagues by members of the Kamina military garrison.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A dead city protest was organized between Oct.26-28 to denounce the insecurity of National Road #4 after 10 civilians were killed and several others kidnapped in the area over the past 2 weeks.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A taxi driver set himself on fire in Lubumbashi to protest "being constantly monitored by the police of the city". He died from his injuries. Police were accused of stopping taxis constantly, which led to the actions of the driver.

properties.ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: IDPs/Refugees (Central African Republic)
properties.NOTES: 28 anti-Balaka fighters crossed into DR-Congo and raided the Bosobolo and Mobayi-Mbongo areas, firing shots into the air and looting refugees camps. They also allegedly committed "abuses" against the population, likely including violence against civilians based on their actions during a previous raid.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: IDPs/Refugees (Central African Republic)

They also allegedly committed "abuses" against the population, likely including violence against civilians based on their actions during a previous raid.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces launched a joint offensive against the ADF in the Beni territory, including attacks on ADF forces in the Eringeti and Oicha areas with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces launched a joint offensive against the ADF in the Beni territory, including attacks on ADF forces in the Eringeti and Oicha areas with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 3 FARDC soldiers were killed and 1 injured after ADF rebels fired a rocket at a vehicle traveling on National Road #4 near Linzo-Sisene in Beni territory. Another soldier dies from his injuries before reaching hospital.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Civilians (International)
properties.NOTES: 2 Two Concern Worldwide workers, a Congolese citizen and a British national, were abducted outside Kibua by 4 men from an unidentified armed group.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 1 person was killed and 4 kidnapped by FDLR rebels in the Kisimba area. The hostages were later confirmed to have been killed by police in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: WFP: World Food Programme
properties.NOTES: 16 aid workers from CEDERU, an affiliate of the WFP, were abducted in the Katwiguru area of Rutshuru territory by an unidentified armed group. 2 women were later released.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Bakata Katanga)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Bakata Katanga Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked the village of Kilunga in the Kitobo area, burning a mill and the chief of police's house, as well as beating up his wife.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Widows of FARDC soldiers protested outside the headquarters of the 34th military region in Goma to demand their pensions.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A trader was killed by 3 alleged assassins who then fled by motorcycle. The killing led to protests the next day.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Shops and schools were closed in Aru in protest against the alleged assassination of a trader who was killed the night before.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen raped 2 women and injured 2 men in the Walendu Bindi area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Marungu)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: An anti-FDLR militia led by a man named Marungu, which operates in the Itala area near Miriki, attacked an FDLR position and was driven off. 2 FDLR rebels were injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mambonde)
properties.NOTES: A local civil society organization has said that a Raia Mutomboki militia led by one Mambonde has taken control of mining sites at Maroc, Abambwa, Sokola bien and Solola bien, in Bakonzo locality in Walikale territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After the lynching of 5 alleged assassins of a trader in Aru, rioters looted shops and pharmacies belonging to members of a particular ethnic community (not specified). The commander of the National Police in Aru tried to calm the protesters after police fired several shots into the air to disperse them.

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 5 alleged assassins of a trader were lynched by the residents of Aru. 3 were killed while 2 others were taken to an unknown location.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 7 people were killed in the space of a week in the Walikale territory (3 fatalities coded in another event).

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: An alleged "burglar hairdresser" was lynched by the residents of Kalemie.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: APCLS forces attacked a FARDC camp in the Kibati area of Kashebere, once on Nov.5, and again on Nov.6. No casualties were reported. Many civilians were displaced.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Youths angry about the murder of a girl by gunmen protested. Police arrived to disperse them, and allegedly seized phones and money during the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed by FDLR rebels in the Walikale, and 3 others kidnapped.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 40 LRA attackers overwhelmed a force of 5 FARDC soldiers in Bondo, killing 3 and kidnapping 5 civilians.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: APCLS forces attacked a FARDC camp in the Kibati area of Kashebere, once on Nov.5, and again on Nov.6. No casualties were reported. Many civilians were displaced.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers pursued LRA fighters who had attacked Bondo, causing some injuries.

properties.ACTOR1: Baye Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Inhabitants of Baye, near Bondo, attacked Mbororo herders in the area after an attack by the LRA, beating and humiliating them. They also reportedly killed one of the Mbororo herders who was mistaken for an LRA member.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed, including a FARDC soldier, after a dispute between two groups of soldiers near a mining concession in the Bushushu plateau in Kalehe territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: "Non-caregivers" went on strike to demand higher wages.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: PPRD activists protested in Kikwit, demanding the resignaton of the mayor within 48 hours.

properties.ACTOR1: JUNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Youth
properties.NOTES: General Zazou, the leader of the youth UNAFEC, allegedly kidnapped a citizen and took them to the UNAFEC HQ where they were tortured, and is what led to his arrest which sparked clashes between youth UNAFEC members and the police.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Yakutumba Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked FARDC soldiers in the Sebele area in Fizi territory, resulting in 1 soldier killed and 3 militiamen wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels attacked a military barracks in Oicha, killing one civilian and stealing livestock.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Marungu)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 2 FDLR rebels were killed and several houses burnt down during an attack by FDLR rebels on the Mayi Mayi militia commanded by Marungu near Katundula in southern Lubero. Several FDLR members and 2 civilians were injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: JUNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Youth
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Several young activists of UNAFEC were wounded in clashes with police in Lubumbashi. They were protesting the arrest of some young member sof Kyungu wa Kumwanza. 7 people were arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 4 people were injured during a demonstration by employees of the Ruashi Mining company. They set up barricades and burned tires to block access to the companies site, before the police intervened with tear gas and dispersed the protest.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Agents of the commercial transport and ports company (SCTP) started a strike to denounce the withdrawal of the government in public entreprises like theirs.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Bakata Katanga)
properties.NOTES: Bakata Katanga Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked a village in the Kitobo area, firing into the air to cause panic before looting shops and setting fire to to an office and some homes.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Agents of the airway authority (RVA) of Bukavu went on stirke to demand payment arrears.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Guards of Okapi National Park
properties.NOTES: A park warden at the Okapi Wildlife Reserve was killed by Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen near Mambasa.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 people, including a FARDC soldier, were killed by LRA rebels in the Garamba National Park area closer to Dungu. It is believed the attack was related to poaching, and "soldiers chased the attackers" after the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Union of Patriots for the Defense of the Innocents)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 5 FDLR rebels were killed and more wounded in a clash with UPDI Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Kimaka area of Lubero. 2 UPDI members were also killed. The fighting also caused displacement of the local population.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Butachibera)
properties.NOTES: An armed group called "RM Butachibera" have allegedly occupied the Mubugu area of Kalehe and engaged in extortion of the civilian population.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Mweke)
properties.NOTES: In the Muloho chiefdom in Kalehe, a militia led by "Mweke" has proclaimed itself in charge of the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: Nyatura militiamen have allegedly occupied the Katasomwa area of Kalehe and begun demanding merchants pay for the right to operate in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Hamakombo)
properties.NOTES: Raia Mutomboki Hamakombo militiamen have allegedly occupied the Bunyakiri area of Kalehe, plundering property and forcing civilians to pay taxes.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: 1 motorcycle driver was killed and 1 injured by LRA rebels in the village of Paika near Dungu. The second was taken to Dungu for treatment.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 2 people were seriously injured with machetes by ADF rebels in the Walese Vonkutu chiefdom in Irumu, during attacks on the villages of Madibe, masome, and Apinzi 1, 2 and 3. They also looted goods and livestock.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: At least 24 arrests have been made by Congolese security forces of suspected Burundian rebels who have attempted to infiltrate themselves into DR-Congo since the beginning of November.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 15 civilians were killed between Nov.15-16 by FDLR rebels in the Mutenda area south of Lubero territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: About 200 officials of the public administration of Mbandaka protested to demand wage arrears and six months of benefits. They burned tires outside the offices of their relevant Minister, but there were no clashes with police.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes occurred between hundreds of students of the National Institute of Buildings and Public Works (INBTP) and the police during protests related to rising tuition and expenses, as well as the eviction of students from some university residences. Students threw rocks and burned tires and cars, causing police intervention which led to the clashes.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Road workers have gone on strike to demand increased salaries agreed upon previously with the government.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 18 people were wounded, including 3 policemen by stone throwing and two journalists by gunfire, after clashes broke out between police and local residents during protests against the Chief Medical Officer of the area who is accused of embezzling a large amount of money. 9 people, including the director of Radio Maendeleo, were arrested although some were later released. Police allegedly fired into the crowd during their dispersal of the protesters.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Kasai Oriental nurses have gone on strike to demand increased risk premiums and other administrative changes to salaries.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 10 people were injured with machetes and guns by ADF rebels who attacked 5 villages in the Walese Vonkutu chiefdom, including Madibe, Masome and Mapenzi. They also looted many homes.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A traffic officer assaulted the son of a Member of Parliament for Budjula in the former province of Ecuador after stopping him for a violation. His father believes the assault is in retaliation for his political activties.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 100 ex-combatants, unarmed, left the Kitona military base to travel to Kinshasa to claim their "bonuses". They were stopped in Boma by FARDC soldiers who convinced them that the issue would be resolved and to return to Kitona.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: State officials protested to demand wage arrears which have built up over 3 months. They marched through the streets of Buta.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale
properties.NOTES: The PNC dispersed a demonstration of students from the Higher Institute of Architecture and Urban Planning (ISAU), leading to clashes. At least one of the students was allegedly wounded by gunfire from the police, who also used tear gas.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.NOTES: A group of 5 Raia Mutomboki militias have met in the Shabunda area to form an alliance against FARDC forces and target their positions.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: Nyatura Mayi Mayi fighters gathered in the Kalehe area to sign an alliance with the FDLR to bolster their fight against FARDC in South Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers recovered the village of Pango, near Hombo, from Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen. 2 militiamen were killed during the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels attacked a FARDC position in Atukaka, 5km away from Kokola in the Mbau area. After pushing the rebels back, ADF forces again attacked them near Tungudu. 3 FARDC soldiers were killed and 9 others injured.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels attacked a FARDC position in Atukaka, 5km away from Kokola in the Mbau area. After pushing the rebels back, ADF forces again attacked them near Tungudu. 3 FARDC soldiers were killed and 9 others injured.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 8 women were raped by FRPI militiamen in the Alingba area of the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in Irumu territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The PNC brought up a strike actions by workers from the roads sector which involved blocking a convoy of vehicles. The police allegedly fired shots and assaulted the drivers, wounding some.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Various women's groups marched to protest against violence against women.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mahoro)
properties.ACTOR2: Kigogo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Violent clashes occurred between the Mahoro Mayi Mayi militia and a youth self-defence group in the Kigogo area. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A young girl was killed by a stray bullet during clashes between protesters and police which followed the death of an MLA for Goma in police custody due to illness.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mabala)
properties.NOTES: 10 people were kidnapped in the Kimbili area, allegedly by Raia Mutomboki militiamen of the Mabala faction.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Handlebar)
properties.NOTES: A coalition of Mayi Mayi Militias, including Kiyandayira from Lubero, Mayi Mayi Handlebar from Walikale, and NDC-R have pushed out FDLR forces from Buleusa, Kateku, Kanune, and Bukumbirwa. Casualties were not reported.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Handlebar)
properties.NOTES: A coalition of Mayi Mayi Militias, including Kiyandayira from Lubero, Mayi Mayi Handlebar from Walikale, and NDC-R have pushed out FDLR forces from Buleusa, Kateku, Kanune, and Bukumbirwa. Casualties were not reported.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: NDC-C fighters attacked FDLR positions in the Walikale area, pushing them out of a village (not named) and forcing them to retreat to Buleusa. Numbers of fatalities were uncertain (coded as 10).

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Civil society groups in Isangi area say police have engaged in robbery and "torture" of local residents in the Yabetuta locality and around Isangi generally.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyakiliba)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen of the Nyakiliba faction attacked Bazile chieftaincy, reportly raping a woman and stealing livestock from Nov.22-23. They were then chased away by FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi
properties.NOTES: FDLR forces counter-attacked NDC-C forces in Bukumbirwa following an assault by the armed group the day before. Numbers of fatalities were uncertain (coded as 10). Other reports stated that NDC-R forces were the ones who pushed them out.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyakiliba)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen of the Nyakiliba faction attacked Bazile chieftaincy, reportly raping a woman and stealing livestock from Nov.22-23. They were then chased away by FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyakiliba)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen of the Nyakiliba faction attacked Bazile chieftaincy, reportly raping a woman and stealing livestock from Nov.22-23. They were then chased away by FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.NOTES: 5 people were killed during an attack by ADF rebels on FARDC positions. The FARDC soldiers were reinforced by MONUSCO forces during the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: More than 100 teachers observed a strike to demand their wages.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Young people in the Kisebwe district of Kalemie protested to denounce the insecurity in their area after gunmen stormed several shops and robbed them the day before. The protesters burned tires on the main roads while others demonstrated at a health centres where one of those injure during the attack had died.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 7 FDLR rebels and 4 civilians were killed during fighting between FDLR and NDC-C forces in the Buleusa area of Walikale area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.NOTES: 200 UDPS activists marched through the streets in memory of the victims of "the repression of November 26, 2011" and the release of political prisoners.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Local residents in Murara district of Goma demonstrated to demand assistance from the provincial government following the destruction of their houses due to heavy rains. Police fired into the air to disperse the protesters.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.NOTES: It was reported that at least 100 suspected Burundian soldiers have infiltrated DR-Congo in the Uvira territory around the Bavira territory's Bijombo plateau.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 4 FARDC soldiers were arrested for the attempted robbery and physical assault of an artisanal miner in South-Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga)
properties.NOTES: 5 civilians were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militiamen from the Ndarumanga faction during an attack on Lukidi village in the Ngweshe chieftancy. They also looted people's homes.

properties.ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
properties.NOTES: 8 armed assailants identified as Anti-Balaka crossed from CAR into the Bosobolo territory of DR-Congo to attack refugees in the Watamba 2 and Ndamu Ubangi River areas, and loot households in Gboduna group.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Lukoba)
properties.NOTES: Raia Mutomboki militiamen of the Lukoba faction ambushed a vehicle and stole the passengers property after beating them up near the Biseti forest in Ngandja territory, which is close to Fizi.

properties.ACTOR1: Mabeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Mabeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 5 people were injured during a clash over a diamond mine between families from the Mabeka area of Walikale involving knives and shotguns.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 12 young members of LUCHA were arrested by police who allegedly fired tear gas and live bullets while dispersing their peaceful protest to demand greater security in the Beni territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua News Agency - French; MONUSCO; Associated Press International; Le Potentiel (Kinshasa); Xinhua General News Service
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels dislodged FARDC soldiers from at least part of Eringeti on Nov.29 before being pushed out a few hours later on Nov.30. The rebels attack stretched from Makembi to Eringeti and simultaneously targeted a FARDC position, a MONUSCO base, a hospital in Eringeti, and the office of the PNC in Beni territory. 1 UN peacekeeper, 7 soldiers, 10 civilians and 21 rebels were killed, while 1 peacekeeper and 4 soldiers were injured. 5 more people believe to have been killed during the fighting were found a few days later. During the violence at least 43 homes were also burned. At least 2,000 people ahve fled following the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 100 teachers demonstrated before the FBN Bank to demand the payment of their salaries for October and November.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Employees of Ruashi Mining have begun a strike to protest the recent administration of their payroll which caused them to pay more taxes.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Oicha called a 72 hour 'dead city' protest strike to denounce the violence of the ADF recently in Eringeti.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Following airstrikes on ADF positions, fierce clashes took place between FARDC/MONUSCO and ADF forces a few kilometres southeast of Eringeti. A spokesman for the UN Secretary-General said at least 13 ADF fighters were killed.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO carried out airstrikes on several ADF rebel positions with helicopters in Beni territory following an attack on one of their camps over the weekend. The UN forces said they had tracked down the rebels that had attacked them on Nov.29-30.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: IDC: Initiative For Democracy in Congo
properties.NOTES: According to the IDC, one of the parties that campaigned against the constitutional referendum in October, 30 of its members have been arrested over over the past few weeks leading up to Dec.18, allegedly related to the violence surrounding the referendum.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers and FDLR forces clashed in the Kibati area, leaving at least 1 dead.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 1 civilian was killed and 7 wounded during an FRPI attack on Kaya, during which they looted several homes.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Union of Patriots for the Defense of the Innocents)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: A coalition of Mayi Mayi militia groups including NDC-R and the UPDI dislodged FDLR rebels from Mashatu and Pita Kongo villages in the Walikale area. During the fighting, FDLR rebels reportedly torched civilian homes. Casualties were not reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have deployed to the Ikobo area of Walikale, setting up bases in an area they have not controlled for over 10 years.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped at least 47 people from two mining centres in Niania (Ituri) and the town of Isiro. At least 1 woman was also raped during the attack, which also involved looting.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped at least 47 people from two mining centres in Niania (Ituri) and the town of Isiro. At least 1 woman was also raped during the attack, which also involved looting.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 4 civilians were killed by FDLR rebels in the Lubero area, allegedly while the rebels were looking for food.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Protesters, mostly bikers, blocked roads with tree trunks to denounce the large number of road blocks requiring tolls maintained by the traffic police in the Fizi area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.NOTES: An older man was allegedly tortured to death by "officers of the intelligence services".

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 13 Raia Mutomboki fighters surrendered and 8 others were captured in the Walikale area and transferred to military prosecutors at the Goma garrison.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Katanga village in the Fizi area fled their villages after alleged attacks by FARDC units operating in the area, resulting in at last 2 people killed, 8 homes burned, and property looted.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels killed 3 people during an ambush in the Nabiapay area, including a captain of the national police.

properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: According to a FARDC spokesman, FARDC soldiers supported by MONUSCO forces have engaged in attacks against FRPI positions in the localities of Mukato, Mabili, Tchanda, and Avelulu Semuliki in Ituri territory. No casualties have been reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Union of Patriots for the Defense of the Innocents)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: During figting between FDLR and UPDI Mayi Mayi forces around Kakune town, which is in the middle of Lubero and Walikale territories, 9 FDLR rebels and 1 UPDI fighter were killed. The UPDI managed to dislodge the FDLR from the town.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: At least 1 civilian and 3 soldiers were killed, 3 soldiers wounded, and 6 houses burned down during a night attack by ADF rebels on Oicha that was repelled by FARDC soldiers. No casualties were reported among the attackers.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: "Dead city" protests were carried out in Oicha and Mbau following an attack by the ADF on Oicha the day before.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: "Dead city" protests were carried out in Oicha and Mbau following an attack by the ADF on Oicha the day before.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: An association of parents of students held a protest march against the premiums the government makes them pay to help fund "substantial" teachers' salaries.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents on either side of the DR-Congo/Rwanda border protested after being told they would not receive expected compensation for their homes built on the borders between the two countries that were scheduled for demolition.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

properties.NOTES: Soldiers from the Bukiringi military camp protested to demand their payment, firing into the air and creating panic among the residents of Bukiringi.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A fight that started between a student and a driver over the driver's allegedly unsafe conduct escalated into a clash between students and police. The police fired shots into the air and allegedly beat up students to get them to dispersed. University property was also destroyed during the incident, although it was not clear how this occurred.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Doctors and nurses in Beni and Oicha have began a 72-hour strike to protest insecurity in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: At least 62 people have gone missing following "abuses" committed by the FDLR in the Buleusa area of Lubero territory. They are believed to have been kidnapped by the FDLR. 16 bodies are later found. Government sources attribute these killings to the FDLR.

properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 3 civilians and 2 FARDC soldiers were killed and 3 soldiers injured in an ADF attack on military positions in the Malolu locality of Beni territory. Houses were also torched during the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 Raia Mutomboki militiamen were killed and 2 others captured during a counter-offensive against the group in the Kalehe area following an attack which killed a FARDC officer earlier in the week.

Following this attack, the coalition counter-attacked the UPDI forces in Kasiki where they had retreated to on Dec.27. During the violence, at least 8 fighters killed as well as at least 1 civilian in Mbwavinywa and several others injured, while many were displaced.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The president of the Business Federation of Congo (FEC) was found dead on the road from Dungu to Durumu (Haut Uele). His body was found tied to a tree and shot in a way that suggested an execution according to security services. It was not clear when he was killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 6 Nyatura militiamen were killed during a clash with FARDC soldiers on Kafufula-Katale road in Kalehe territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A Mayi Mayi militia leader named Lofombo was killed during clashes between his militia and FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A traditional leader was murdered during a New Year's Eve dinner by an unidentified man who has since been detained by FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: 15 LRA rebels allegedly ransacked the Kungu locality of Ango, looting granaries and abducting 4 people to help them carry the stolen property.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA gunmen who attacked the Kungu area earlier in the month attacked Kpokpo area of Ango, looting food and livestock and kidnapping young people to help them carry the goods.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels attacked the Ebale area, looting property and kidnapping 12 people.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 6 Nyatura militiamen were killed during a clash with FARDC soldiers on Kafufula-Katale road in Kalehe territory between Dec.30-31.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A Chinese businessman involved in purchasing malachite was found dead in his private residence. A security source says he was "killed with sharp objects" implying that it was likely a murder (no report of suicide).

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Young people protested in Bunia following the murder of a youth on New Year's Eve.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Prisoners climbed onto the roof to demonstrate against the bad conditions and slow processing of their judicial records.

properties.NOTES: In Makanza, a group of youths from Bongwele district clashed with a youth self-defense group in another district after a string of robberies allegedly caused by someone who lives in their area. Both sides used sticks and knives and no casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 6 individuals were assaulted and 1 wounded by FRPI militiamen who attacked Musana and Kapalayi (near Geti), Mandibe (near Komanda), and Modohiro (near Aveba) between Jan.10-14.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked Boga market and looted cattle. FARDC soldiers deployed quickly and pushed the attackers to Modohiro, where they captured one FRPI member.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: The leader of the FRPI militia which operates primarily in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in the Bunia area has agreed to bring his militia in and join the disarmament, demobilization and reintrgration process.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.NOTES: 6 individuals were assaulted and 1 wounded by FRPI militiamen who attacked Musana and Kapalayi (near Geti), Mandibe (near Komanda), and Modohiro (near Aveba) between Jan.10-14.

properties.NOTES: 6 individuals were assaulted and 1 wounded by FRPI militiamen who attacked Musana and Kapalayi (near Geti), Mandibe (near Komanda), and Modohiro (near Aveba) between Jan.10-14.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After artisanal miners tried to peacefully block FARDC soldiers who were trying to confiscate a shipment of ore, the soldiers opened fire on them, injuring nine, six seriously.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers conducted military operations against the Bede Mayi Mayi militia in the Sange and Kinanira (near Uvira) areas, captured 5 members of the group.

properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers conducted military operations against the Bede Mayi Mayi militia in the Sange and Kinanira (near Uvira) areas, captured 5 members of the group.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels ambushed some motorcyclists, killing 1 and injuring another.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed men looted a dozen houses in the Kinawa neighbourhood in Kirumba, where they took livestock and other property.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Uvira have reported grenades being thrown at night, allegedly by Burundian refugees and/or rebels that have recently crossed the border.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

properties.NOTES: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

properties.NOTES: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: An armed group (believed to be the ADF) fired on a MONUSCO helicopter flying southeast of Eringiti, causing some minor damage.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
