properties.NOTES: 28 members of armed groups surrendered to MONUSCO forces between Jan.13-20. The 28 included 10 Raia Mutomboki militiamen, 7 FDLR, and a number of individuals from other groups, including Bakata Katanga and Kifuafua Mayi Mayi groups.

properties.ACTOR1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The DR-Congo authorities have decided to close the Mokoto IDP camp in Masisi which houses about 4000 IDPs after complaints about criminal activity in the camp and the discovery of a weapon and some stolen cows.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.NOTES: 35 people were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen in the Mambaka locality, close to Biakatu.

properties.ACTOR1: Biakatu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Angry residents of the Biakato area killed a person and burned some houses of Yira (a subset of the Nande ethnic group) members of the community after a traditional leader was killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Biakatu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A traditional leader was reportedly assassinated in the Biakato area, leading to violence by local residents.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 4 FRPI militiamen were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers in the Burasi locality. The military returned 68 cows the militia had stolen to citizens of the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Around 5,000 people protested in Bukavu to demand the holding of presidential elections in 2016.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A coalition of opposition political parties held demonstrations in Goma to commemorate those who died in marches against the revision of the electoral laws in January 2015.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Government forces have forced "local and foreign armed groups" to retreat from the Miriki area. These militias have moved towards the towns of Kamandi and Bunyatenge.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.ACTOR2: Police Guards of Virunga National Park
properties.NOTES: Suspected LRA gunmen attacked park rangers in the Karuruma area of the Virunga National Park. The rangers managed to repulse the attackers, killing one. The LRA has been known to engage in poaching in the area and to conduct attacks against park rangers.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: G7 Opposition Coalition
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Radio Okapi; Radio France Internationale
properties.NOTES: A G7 demonstration to demand presidential elections in 2016 were prevented by police in Kinshasa. About 100 people were arrested (this number also includes the Lubumbashi demonstration which was disrupted).

properties.NOTES: After G7 leaders and supporters entered the Moise Tshombe Square, police and soldiers appeared and prevented the groups from engaging in their demonstration. A member of UNAFEC and journalists fromt he AFP and BBC were arrested and released an hour later. About 100 people were arrested (this number also includes the Kinshasa demonstration which was prevented)

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Government forces have forced "local and foreign armed groups" to retreat from the Miriki area. These militias have moved towards the towns of Kamandi and Bunyatenge.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.NOTES: The leader of the G7 opposition coalition was detained by agents of the National Intelligence Agency in Lubumbashi as he was on his way to his "stronghold" in Kalemie.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed and 4 injured in an attack by the FDLR on Virira village in Lubero territory, about 40km away from Miriki.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 8 local leaders of the Nande community in Nyamilima were arrested on suspicion of setting fire to the home of a local MP. The arrests have led to tensions between the Nande and Hutu communities in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: A young man who escaped ADF kidnappers reported that a group of people were taken in Beni territory and transported to a location near Oicha. At least 5 were killed after chosing not to join the rebel group.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen looted livestock from areas along the Yalingo-Yomayi axis in the Opala area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels allegedly kidnapped 50 families and burned their homes in the Bushalingwa locality of the Ikobo group, which straddles the Lubero and Walikale territories.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have dislodged FDLR rebels from several localities of Walikale and Lubero, including Buleusa, Rusamambo, Mizinga, Rusoha and others as of Jan.31. At least 2 FLDR officers were killed, while weapons and combatants were captured during the operations.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kabazimiya)
properties.NOTES: At least 6 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutmomboki militiamen as they were on their way to a seminar on sexual violence in Lulingu. They were later ransomed.

properties.NOTES: Suspected FRPI militiamen attacked Kengelo, near Aveba. FARDC soldiers responded and killed one of the attackers. FRPI also attacked Ruzinga, near Aveba, and looted property. FARDC soldiers responded and killed one FRPI fighter, and wounded another.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Motorcycle drivers in Iga Barriere broke into a police holding area and freed four inmates, then ransacked the barrier of the Directorate General of Revenue of the Province of Ituri (DGRPI). The incident seemed to be related to a recent robbery leading to casualties among motorcyclists in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: After some gunmen robbed a gas station, a group of motorcycle drivers tried to chase them down. During the chase, the gunmen opened fire on their pursuers, killing a taxi driver and seriously injuring another.

properties.NOTES: 6 people were killed, including 5 Nande and 1 Hutu, and at least 2 Hutu injured, as well as many people displaced, in retaliatory violence against civilians between the Nande and Hutu communities in the Lubero area, specifically in the villages of Lusuli, Kyuto, and Bwambuli. Hundreds of homes were also allegedly burnt down.

Hundreds of homes were also allegedly burnt down.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed in Kavuye, near Pinga, after they refused to pay taxes to the FDLR.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: In Rutshuru, FDLR rebels attacked the village of Kibende, kidnapping 3 people. They also kidnapped 4 Nande community members and burned 7 homes in the Mirangi region, also in Rutshuru.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

properties.NOTES: At least 21 people were killed, 40 injured, and many homes were burned when the NDC-R attacked Mukeberwa, an FDLR stronghold. The NDC-R were allegedly aligned with Nande fighters and were supported by young people from Lubero, with the fighting having been widely reported as ethnic violence between Nande and Hutu.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 people watching the final match of Chan 2016 between DRC and Mali were shot dead in Masisi by unidentified gunmen wearing military uniforms. Among the victims was the commander of the sub-police station of Burungu. Several serious injuries were also reported.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
properties.NOTES: FDLR-RUD forces were pushed out of the Mashuta locality of Walikale by an unnamed coalition of Mayi Mayi militias.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
properties.NOTES: Opposition activists organise a national strike and call for President Kabila to step down from office.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 villages in the southern part of Lubero were torched by an unidentified armed group.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police and military forces have been "deployed massively" to Miriki and the governor of North Kivu has temporarily relocated to the city as well in an effort to put an end to growing ethnic violence between the local Nande and Hutu populations.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Protesting employees of the SNCC in Kalemie clashed with police after they attempted to attack one of the SNCC's trains.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua News Agency - French
properties.NOTES: 6 people were killed by ADF rebels who attacked the village of Lesse, 50km north of Oicha. They also kidnapped 14 people who carried looted property. At least 30 houses are said to have been torched as well.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 5 FRPI militiamen were killed and 9 captured during clashes with the Congolese military in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom, around the village of Avara and Mont Alimo.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 5 FRPI militiamen were killed and 9 captured during clashes with the Congolese military in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom, around the village of Avara and Mont Alimo.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: At least 16 civilians were killed in an attack by ADF rebels on Kambi Ya Chui village in Beni territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
properties.SOURCE: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: An opposition leader and one of the planners of a strike to demand elections within the constitutional leader was arrested by military intelligence agents just before the strike. He is the leader of the ECIDE political party and a national deputy. He was released the same day.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels have allegedly abducted as many as 296 people from CAR and DR-Congo in the first quarter of 2016, according to the NGOs Resolve and Invisible Children.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: G7 Opposition Coalition
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: The national strike called by the G7 coalition to demand elections be held within the constitutional deadlines was also held in Bukavu, and was well-attended. Police arrested at least one local opposition leader by the ANR.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: CF: Citizen Front
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The national strike called by the G7 coalition to demand elections be held within the constitutional deadlines was also held in Goma. Some activists of the Citizen Front were arrested by police during the strike. Some students also seem to have been arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: G7 Opposition Coalition
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
properties.NOTES: A well-attended "dead city" strike was called by the G7 coalition, virtually shutting down Kinshasa. They are demanding that elections be held within the constitutional deadline. Around 3:00pm police were deployed in force to ensure calm, but no incidents were reported. RFI broadcasts were also reported to be unavailable, potentially "scrambled". At least 2 young activists also allegedly went missing, and are believed to have been arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: G7 Opposition Coalition
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: The national strike called by the G7 coalition to demand elections be held within the constitutional deadlines was also held in Lubumbashi, but was not well-attended compared to Kinshasa. There was a major deployment of police and army in the city.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The national strike called by the G7 coalition to demand elections be held within the constitutional deadlines was held in Uvira. The police arrested the spokesman of the UNC for allegedly organizing Uvira's strike, but later released him after some of his colleagues staged a sit-in outside the offices of the intelligence services in the city.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Colleagues of a UNC spokesman arrested earlier in the day staged a sit-in for his release outside the offices of the intelligence service in the city.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 Raia Mutomboki militiamen from the Kazimoto group were killed during an ambush by FARDC soldiers in the Ntuku area of Shabunda territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

properties.NOTES: Police allegedly dispersed a group of about 100 activists of the ECIDE party as they were gathered to await the arrival of the leader of their party. The police threatened and assaulted the ECIDE members despite the protest having been approved by the mayor of Bandundu.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: About 100 houses were burned, and some were allegedly looted, and thousands of people forced to flee during a major demolition drive of allegedly illegal houses in the Masisi territory by the security forces.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: An alleged ADF recruitment network was dismantled in Beni by FARDC with the arrest of two men and a woman who belonged to the organization.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Bobandu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Bokenge Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 1 policeman was killed and another disappeared in clashes with residents of the Bobandu and Bokenge areas over the arrest of some children.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 20 families engaged in a sit-in in Goma to ask the provincial authority to help sort out a land dispute.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 50 military widows of the 31st military region took to the streets of Kisangani to demand their husbands pensions.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Drakpa Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 1 youth was killed during clashes between the police and young people in Drakpa after they resisted arrest. The youths were chasing opponents and burning huts of those associated with a chief who had fled the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed, many others wounded, and a camp built by the DDR section of the FARDC soldiers at the Kitona base was ransacked after demobilized members of militant groups from the eastern DRC rioted over the burial of one of their colleagues.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Armed men broke into the home of a trader and killed him, and then raped his wife. At least 2 soldiers and 2 civilians were later arrested as accomplices to this and two other murders of traders which occurred over the weekend.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.NOTES: Raia Mutomboki militiamen have been accused by the inhabitants of Shabunda of extortion, hostage taking, and ambushes against civilians, especially along the Burhale-Shabunda road.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked a police station at Bwederu Lukweti in the Bashali-Mokoto group, and stole some weapons during the battle.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyanzale Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua News Agency - French
properties.NOTES: An IDP was allegedly killed by residents of Nyanzale. The body was found in the IDP camp.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Over a week long offensive, FARDC soldiers dislodged Raia Mutomboki militiamen from the localities of Nyambembe, Nduma and Swiza in the Shabunda territory. 5 militiamen were also killed, while a soldier held hostage by the group was also freed.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 policemen were killed by Nyatura Mayi Mayi militia who stole their weapons.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Four gunmen fired at a traders house, killing him and seriously wounding his wife. At least 2 soldiers and 2 civilians were later arrested as accomplices to this and two other murders of traders which occurred over the weekend.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A well-known trader was killed by "criminals" who also stole a large sum of money. At least 2 soldiers and 2 civilians were later arrested as accomplices to this and two other murders of traders which occurred over the weekend.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After 3 prominent traders in the area were killed by bandits, people in Nyakunde torched the local police office and lynched a soldier.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyanzale Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 4 Nyanzale villagers were killed and 40 houses burned in a clash with IDPs living in the area after an IDP was allegedly killed by Nyanzale residents. At least 2 additional fatalities were later attributed to the violence without details.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: At least 12 civilians were killed and 23 houses were burned by ADF rebels who attacked the Ntombi/Mambabio area. Injuries were also reported, as well as goats stolen. 7 of the deaths occurred in the village of Ntombi/Mambabio, while at least 5 others were beheaded in Pene (3km from Ntombi).

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: At least 12 civilians were killed and 23 houses were burned by ADF rebels who attacked the Ntombi/Mambabio area. Injuries were also reported, as well as goats stolen. 7 of the deaths occurred in the village of Ntombi/Mambabio, while at least 5 others were beheaded in Pene (3km from Ntombi).

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.NOTES: Raia Mutomboki militiamen burned over 100 houses during an attack on the village of Bunyangungu in the Ziralo group of South Kivu. No fatalities were reported but many of the residents were displaced.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed around the Vitchumbi-Kibirizi road in Rutshuru territory by unidentified armed assailants. Kidnappings have also been reported in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Save the Children
properties.NOTES: 3 Save the Cildren employees were kidnapped from a convoy of vehicles in the Lubero area by unidentified armed men. They were later released.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: FDLR-FOCO rebels backed by Nyatura militiamen attacked Bulindu village in the Kisimba area of Walikale, killing 5 people, including at least one traditional leader and some members of his family, and burning 8 houses. They also attacked Kihula and Kalembe villages, torching 5 houses and causing residents to flee the area. 10 people were also reported kidnapped from Kalembe.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: FDLR-FOCO rebels backed by Nyatura militiamen attacked Nsuka village in the Burongo group in Walikale, killing 5 people, including two traditional leaders and some members of their families. They also attacked Kihula and Kalembe villages, torching 5 houses and causing residents to flee the area. 10 people were also reported kidnapped from Kalembe.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A joint military operation has been launched by FARDC and National Police forces in the Masisi territory to recapture it from Nyatura and APCLS forces following the retreat from five police stations in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Guards of Okapi National Park
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen killed 2 soldiers and seriously injured an Okapi park guard in an attack on a mining quarry at Penge. They also managed to kidnap 3 soldiers and 5 guards.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (PARECO)
properties.NOTES: 2 teachers were raped and a man wounded with a machete by FDLR and Mayi Mayi Pareco fighters in the Bingi area.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: Suspected FRPI gunmen raided 4 villages in south Irumu. During the raids, 1 person was killed and at least 2 wounded. Livestock and property were also stolen.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen killed 1 person in a raid on a village near Nyakazanga Osso farm in Masisi.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen killed 5 people and injured 4 during a raid on Murambi in Masisi.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers and Mayi Mayi Gumino militiamen clashed in the Kajambwe, Mugeti and Murambya areas of Bijombo highlands area. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 youths were killed during a clash between police and artisanal miners in Durba over a gold concession owned by a South African company. The violence allegedly started during a march by members of the local "Youth League" which was organized to demand that the authorities grant them rights to mine the area. Police allegedly fired first, while the youths threw stones.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A student was allegedly murdered by a policeman, causing tensions in the city between the youth and police.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Women staged a march organized by the Ministry of Women, Family and Children called "zero tolerance" to denounce the impunity for perpetrators of violence against women.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The Provincial Council for Women in Kasai-Oriental organized a march to mark International Women's Day in Mbuji-Mayi.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: UPC: Union of Congolese Patriots
properties.NOTES: 16 combatants from the Lafontaine Mayi Mayi militia as well as the official in charge of intelligence for the UPC surrendered to FARDC forces in Kanyatsi, along with 2 bandits.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: As many as 565 doctors observed a sit-in outside the office of the Minister of Health to demand risk premiums owed to them from the last 4 years.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A helicopter from the South African contingent of MONUSCO came under fire from an unidentified armed group as it was flying towards Goma. The helicopter was damaged but no injuries were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) Republican Guard
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNADEF: National Union of Democrats and Federalists
properties.NOTES: After a governor candidate from UNADEF arrived in Kalemie, the Republican Guard allegedly impeded his travel and assaulted supporters who had come to greet him.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: "An opposition radio and television broadcasting in Lubumbashi" was shut down by the police who said it had not paid an annual fee. The station, La Voix du Katanga, said the decision was political, as it was owned by a leading figure in the G7 opposition coalition.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Bafuliru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The leader of a local defense group from Bafuliru surrendered with 20 fighters and their weapons to the FARDC in the Uvira area.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: A nurse was attacked by FRPI militiamen in the Walendu Bindi area.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: Customary authorities in the Walendu Bindi area have accused the FRPI of theft, rape and murder (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Local police and civilians fled the village of Busumba in Masisi territory after Mayi Mayi militia fighters moved into the area and took control.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Women of Dungu territory protested against the abduction of children by LRA rebels. They say at least 1000 children were abducted last year, with about 400 of them later being released.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Guards of Virunga National Park
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: A joint attack by Mayi Mayi militiamen and FDLR rebels on Virunga park ranger positions, which were then reinforced by FARDC, resulting in 2 park guards and 5 attackers killed. The 2 park guards were allegedly captured and executed by their assailants, while another went missing. The events happened around Lake Edward.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A leader of the Mayi Mati Nyatura militia kidnapped a girl from the Mpati IDP camp in Masisi.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: The spokesman of the Sokola II military operations by the FARDC said that they had dislodged FDLR and Chondo Mayi Mayi militiamen, although the exact location was unclear

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed while traveling from Vitshumbi to Kibirizi market by armed men belived to be FDLR rebels.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Teachers in Dungu territory engaged in a 5-day strike against the non-payment of salaries for the month of February.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hema Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A significant member of the Hema community was kidnapped by FRPI militiamen.

properties.ACTOR1: Balala Rondo
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders
properties.NOTES: 2 armed men, believed to be part of the Balala Rondo vigilante militia, robbed a MSF camp in Baraka, which has led to a reduction in MSF operations in the area. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 jailed Lucha activists began a hunger strike against their incarceration.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed in Kanyatsi by unidentified armed men. Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen have recently been operational in the Masisis area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Prisoners at the central prison in Bunia began a protest on the prison roof over water and food shortages.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Lucha activists engaged in a silent march in Goma to demand the release of 2 of their members who have been incarcerated for over a year. During the protests police arrested 18 Lucha activists.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.NOTES: A dozen suspected Raia Mutomboki gunmen stole livestock and property from Ngamba in Kalehe.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 50 visa-seekers staged a sit-in in front of the Chinese embassy in Kinshasa against the establishment of a separate agency to handle visa application, due to expected fee increases.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: The police station in Kirumbu was closed and the police withdrawn after Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen took control of the town.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen killed a local leader in Masisi as he was heading from Lushebere to sell livestock in Mutiri.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Tanzania (2015-)
properties.NOTES: Tanzanian MONUSCO peacekeepers have been accused of sexual abuse in the Mavivi area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Between 15-42 corpses have been found in the Tama and Itala groupings over the last two weeks. Few details were available and it's not clear who is responsible.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 2 ADF rebels were killed in a battle with FARDC soldiers in the Mabanga area of Beni territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A human rights activist, Evariste Kasali, was killed in his home by unidentified assailants.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Families of police and military personnel protested against attempts to evict them from a military camp in Kinshasa that had originally been a transit point for military personnel moving within the country before becoming a dwelling place. The police and military personnel who had been sent to evict them fired shots in the air to attempt to disperse them.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Members of the Nande community in Kinshasa staged a sit-in at the "People's Palace" to demand the maintenance of peace in North Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen killed 1, assaulted 3 others, and looted houses in areas near Gety in south Bunia between Mar.18-20.

properties.ACTOR1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Clashes between Nande and Hutu were reported centred on the University of Goma. Few details were available.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels attacked FARDC positions around Tungudu and Opira in Beni territory. They were repelled after about an hour, resulting in 2 rebels killed and 1 soldier seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels attacked FARDC positions around Tungudu and Opira in Beni territory. They were repelled after about an hour, resulting in 2 rebels killed and 1 soldier seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A priest from Bunyuka in Beni territory was killed by a group of 10 unidentified armed men who broke into the convent of his parish. The administrator of the Beni territory believes this was a targeted assassination. He was from the Nande ethnic group.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A priest of the Congregation of Caracholine Nyamilima was seriously wounded by unidentified gunmen while he was on his way to mass. The attack is believed to have been carried out by FDLR rebels.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Ngungu protested against killings in their area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: A large force of FRPI, including at least 115 militiamen, on the town of Tchekele was aborted after FARDC and MONUSCO forces deployed to the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Special units of FARDC launched an operations against Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Bashali-Mokoto area of Masisi. In the areas of Busumba and Kibarizo, militiamen reatreated in the face of FARDC's advance.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Djugu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Angry residents of Djugu territory attacked police stations and an army post during ongoing clashes between two communal groups in the area over a land dispute. The residents allegedly don't support the presence of security forces in their area. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Bulana Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Waza Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed, as many as 100 injured, and nearly 530 residences destroyed during clashes between residents of Bulana and Waza armed with knives due to a land dispute between the two neighbouring villages in Djugu between Mar.21-22.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 2 FARDC soldiers were injured in an ambush by FRPI in the Batumbi locality, near Geti.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Special units of FARDC launched an operations against Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Bashali-Mokoto area of Masisi. In the areas of Busumba and Kibarizo, militiamen reatreated in the face of FARDC's advance.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Anyada, during which they robbed 4 houses. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A "dead city" strike was carried out in Butembo on the call of the Nande community for 48-hours.

properties.ACTOR1: Bulana Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Waza Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed, as many as 100 injured, and nearly 530 residences destroyed during clashes between residents of Bulana and Waza armed with knives due to a land dispute between the two neighbouring villages in Djugu between Mar.21-22.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 4 people were assaulted by FRPI militiamen in Kolu, near Gety. 1 FRPI militiamen was also killed in a reported exchange of gunfire, but the details were not clear.

properties.ACTOR1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Around 100 people armed with knives and gasoline stormed the University of Goma campus, inuring several students and academic staff and burning offices. It was not clear whether the students/staff they injured were specifically Hutu. University staff say they were Nande, and they were angry that the university Head wasn't Nande, saying Hutu were taking control at other communities' expense. 15 were later arrested by police.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI elements attacked the village of Kagaba, assaulting two women and kidnapping 4 others.

properties.ACTOR1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed Mbororo killed a man as a result of intercommunal tensions in the Kaka II region.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: 23 people were abducted by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Chuma Maliene Jado. They were released after a payment of a ransom.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO reported that 8 individuals, including the former head of the village of Kaitango, were kidnapped by FRPI militiamen in the region between Kaitango/Kaimagaro in the Bukiringi area.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Dungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO and Dungu local safety committee members established "peacekeeping missions" in Kaka II and Dungu to end intercommunal tensions in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: Abuses against civilians were reportedly perpetrated by the FRPI between Mar.21-23.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Agents and managers of the SCPT (formerly OCPT) took to the streets at Beatrice Hotel in Kinshasa to prevent the Deputy Prime Minister in charge of telecommunications from holding a meeting intended to finalize a law on the liberalization of the telecom sector.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 Mayi Mayi "Karakara" militiamen laid an ambush for FARDC soldiers on a bridge in the Luberizi area. They were captured by the soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: Nyatura-FDLR coalition forces harassed the population of Busumba caused more than 1,300 people to flee to the Mweso area.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: 24 APCLS fighters were captured by MONUSCO peacekeepers in different areas of Rutshuru and Lubero.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 1 civilian was killed and 3 others injured in an ADF ambush on the Mbau-Kamango axis.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.NOTES: ADF forces attacked FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. The attack occurred near a bridge that led towards Uganda. Many ADF were reportedly wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO helicopters engaged in "several offensives" against ADF rebels in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. Casualty numbers weren't reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The "leader" of the Goma suburb of Mugunga was killed by a group of assailants which included soldiers and the district chief of Lac Vert.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: An unidentified armed group from South Sudan who were engaged in poaching attacked a FARDC position in the Ngilima area. 2 of the assailants were killed. Instances of South Sudanese military personnel poaching in the DR-Congo have been observed over the past few months. Other sources claimed 3 soldiers were also killed.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: ADF rebels killed 1, caused injuries, kidnapped 2, and burned 28 houses during attacks on the Vudaki, Misongo and Kamvuyo villages in Npkele, in Beni territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels fought with security forces in the Bondo area, resulting in 1 rebel killed.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels ambushed and robbed civilians in the areas of Gongolo and Mabadaba respectively, 12km north of Ngilima.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 1 civilian was killed and 2 others wounded during ADF attacks on FARDC positions in Kwele and Budaki, 22km east of Eringeti. MONUSCO forces arrived to support the FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers dislodged FRPI militiamen from six of their camps in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom, situated in the Irumu area. Fatalities allegedly occurred, but specific numbers were not reported (coded as 10).

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi Nyatura militiamen raided Kizimba, firing indiscriminately and causing the population to flee.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FDLR, APCLS and possibly other Mayi Mayi militias fought against FARDC soldiers in the Mpati area of Mashali Mokoto between Mar.26-28 (other events coded elsewhere). 12 rebels were reportedly killed over the three days, along with other casualties (these 12 fatalities were split across the events).

properties.ACTOR1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Armed Mbororo allegedly laid an ambush for FARDC soldiers in the area of Ngilima. 3 of the assailants were killed, while some FARDC soldiers were injured.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels attacked a vehicle, killing its driver and kidnapping 7 people in the Armoirie area of Rwindi.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed by an FDLR-Nyatura ambush near a bridge in the Mpati area of Bashali Mokoto in Masisi territory. This event was part of 3 days of clashes during which 12 rebels were reported to have been killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers allegedly arbitrarily detained a boatman and demanded a ransom before releasing him in the Kabeya-Kamuanga area.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: During a clash between FDLR-Nyatura and FARDC forces in the Mpati area of Bashali Mokoto in Masisi territory, at least 2 FDLR rebels and 2 soldiers were killed. 1 FDLR rebel was also captured. APCLS forces allegedly also supported the FDLR-Nyatura fighters. This event was part of 3 days of clashes during which 12 rebels were reported to have been killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hundreds of Brasimba officers staged a work stoppage in Lubumbashi after it was announced that some benefits would be halved and others eliminated.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A man was killed by an unidentified group in Kamuronza group in Masisi territory, causing residents of the area to take refuge in neighbouring groups.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Mugunga protested and blocked roads to demand a verdict against those believed to be behind the killing of the "leader" of Mugunga.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Guards of Garamba National Park
properties.NOTES: An LRA rebel involved in poaching was killed by Garamba park guards.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki-Mabala forces in the Nindja area of Kabare have caused displacement of residents to Kalonge. 4 soldiers and 3 militiamen were reported killed.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have withdrawn from the Ihana area of Walikale, followed by an occupation by NDC-R forces.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Guards of Kahuzi-Biega National Park
properties.NOTES: A park ranger in Kahuzi-Biega National Park was killed by suspected rebels, although their affiliation was not reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mirage)
properties.NOTES: Raia Mutomboki-Mirage militiamen have occupied the villages of the Bakonjo grouping of Walikale after the withdrawal of FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki Mabala militiamen were reported in the Bushamba area of Kabare territory. 9 were killed, including 4 soldiers and 5 rebels, with 2 soldiers injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Heavy weapons have allegedly been moved into Lubumbashi by FARDC, including tanks. Residents have expressed concern that the stockpiling of heavy weapons systems is connected with the coming elections.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen were reported to have committed "many atrocities against civilians" during an occupation of the mining town of Muchacha in Ituri. Specifically, at least 2 women were raped by militiamen and property was looted, before they withdrew from the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A FARDC soldier allegedly shot a woman in the chest in the Walikale area, injuring her. No other information was provided in the report.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified armed men referred to as poachers looted property and raped women in the Wamba area, including in the villages of Bapoa, Opiko, Baza and Agoyo. Sudanese soldiers and LRA rebels are known to poach in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Guards of Kahuzi-Biega National Park
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified armed men fired on Kahuzi-Biega park guards. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kyakwama)
properties.NOTES: Clashes have occured recently in the Lulingu between the Raia Mutomboki Kazimoto and Kyakwama militias on one side and the Kabazimiya faction on the other have resulted in the deaths of at least 4 civilians, all of whom are reportedly members of the family of the Kyakwama militia's leader. These clashes were sparked by the killing of the Kabazimiya leader's son on Apr.27, which is when they started (first reported on May.12).

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: Some Nyatura-FDLR coalition fighters killed the traditional leader of Zanganano village in the Boshimo area of Bashali Mokoto grouping.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Health providers at 25 health centers, including a general hospital in the Oicha area, observed a work stoppage to protest insecurity in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Mabala)
properties.NOTES: A traditional leader from Kimbili village was kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki-Mabala militiamen.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The Bweru IDP camp was emptied after an ultimatum was given by FARDC to leave the area given their alleged support to Nyatura-FDLR coalition forces, following battles between FARDC and Nyatura-FDLR forces around the Mpati IDP camp. There were some reports of shots being heard during the emptying of the camp of its 35,000 inhabitants.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Suspected Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Binza area killed the "Hutu president" of Binza group.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyamilima Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of the Binza area beat a soldier who came upon the murder of the "Hutu president" of the Binza group. It was not clear if they thought he had killed him, or if there was another reason for the violence. 2 people were seriously injured during the incident when the soldier fired on the crowd while attempting to escape. He was then "arrested and stoned by the angry crowd", which led to his death.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Fishermen of Lake Edward started a strike to protest harassment by Mayi Mayi fighters active in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Residents of the Binza area demonstrating after the death of a "Hutu president" in the area were engaged by the military, which arrested many of them. Few details were available on the event.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A young girl was injured during a funeral march for a the recently killed "Hutu president" of the area when an unidentified assault opened fire on the crowd. The march seems to have also seems to have been a demonstration, as protesters were later arrested by the military.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 23 Raia Mutomboki militiamen were captured by FARDC soldiers in different areas of South Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Lendu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hema Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A local Lendu leader looted= allegedly seized about 390 cows from Hema community members while accompanied by suspected FRPI militiamen. 80 cows were later reclaimed by Hema community members peacefully.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Heavy weapons firing was heard in the Kiliba area where FARDC soldiers have been staging an offensive against FNL rebels in conjunction with the Burundian army (which is operating on its side of the border).

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: More than 10 people were injured during a clash between students of the Higher Institute of Agronomic Studies Bengamisa and police in Bayaswa, near Kisangani (Tshopo). The dispute started over the arrest of a student by traffic police.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Traders in Dungu (Haut Uele) began a strike to demand the departure of the head of the territorial department for the economy.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.NOTES: 55 people were kidnapped by Raia Mutomboki militias (led by Kokodikoko and Dembi Kaboyi) between the villages of Kifuko and Kamituga. At least 18 people were also raped and property stolen.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Nizi and workers of the SOKIMO gold minig company staged a demonstration to oppose the signing of a gold mining agreement between the their company and another.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed by ADF rebels during an ambush in the Opira area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed by FRPI militiamen during an ambush in the town of Kolu near Aveba.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (PARECO)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi Pareco and Nyatura militiamen have allegedly committed "several atrocities" against residents of the town of Kalembe in North Kivu. They are also accused of holding residents of the village hostage and levying taxes against them.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 villages in the Kitababeya group in the Salamabila area of Maniema were attacked by 4 heavily armed men in military uniforms. In the first village they looted property, kidnapped people, and raped at least one woman. 4 people were also seriously injured in the attack. The second village saw looting and "torture" of the resdients, but no cases of rape or serious injuries, although one woman was reported to have two broken ribs.

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 men were allegedly killed by their sons after the sons accused their fathers of being "witches" following the deaths of a sister and brother due to childbirth and malaria respectively.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed in an explosion either caused by a car bomb or grenade targeting a vehicle on the main street of Bukavu, in the Ibanda municipality.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-)
properties.NOTES: Hundreds of Rwandan soldiers allegedly crossed into DR-Congo territory in the Buhimba area while searching for FDLR forces.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 2 women were wounded by gunfire and 2 others kidnapped and property stolen during raids by FRPI militiamen against at least 7 villages in the Walendu Bindi chieftancy, near Irumu.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 4 employees of an international NGO were ambushed by FRPI fighters around Kamatsi. They were robbed and released.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 men in police uniforms allegedly attempted to steal a motorcycle from a private residence and killed 2 people who attempted to resist them. 1 woman was also injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Motorcycle taxi drivers engaged in a strike against insecurity in Shabunda.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ACTOR2: Kawangu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked the Kawangu locality, near Geti. One woman wounded an FRPI fighter with a machete while attempting to resist their pillaging, and was in turn injured by gunfire.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinua News Agency - French
properties.NOTES: At least 2 people were killed and 8 injured, including a policeman and a soldier, following rioting by the resident of Kolwezi after police allegedly killed 2 people while attempting to steal a motorcycle the night before. The police are reported to have fired on the crowd when its members demanded to see the bodies of those killed. 2 bodies were later found in a nearby lake, and are believed to have died in relation to the rioting in Kolwezi.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mercy Corps
properties.NOTES: 5 aid workers of the NGO Mercy Corps were abducted by alleged Nyatura fighters and FDLR in the Mushikiri area between Nyanzale and Kikuku. The workers were later released.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: FEC: Federation of Congolese Enterprises
properties.NOTES: The FEC organized a 48-hour "dead city" strike to protest against the robbery of a shop by armed men with machetes who stole a significant sum of money and property.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police torched around 140 houses in the village of Asanga Kianga, allegedly in retaliation for the death of a police officer as he carried out his duties by a resident of the village.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 12 people were killed in clashes between FARDC soldiers and Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen in the Biakato area. 11 of those killed were militiamen. 3 others were also injured.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
properties.NOTES: 3 FARDC soldiers died of their injuries after an ambush by the FDLR in the Buvunga area of Rutshuru. The deaths were alternatively reported to have occurred during an attack on a camp in the Katale area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
properties.NOTES: UNAFEC offices in Kinshasa and Lubumbashi were allegedly invaded by police (or "bandits" supervised by security forces, depending on the article) who damaged property and took down party banners and other effects.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: FEC: Federation of Congolese Enterprises
properties.NOTES: The FEC organized a 48-hour "dead city" strike to protest against the robbery of a shop by armed men with machetes who stole a significant sum of money and property.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
properties.NOTES: UNAFEC offices in Kinshasa and Lubumbashi were allegedly invaded by police (or "bandits" supervised by security forces, depending on the article) who damaged property and took down party banners and other effects. In Lubumbashi UNAFEC supporters threw stones at men in uniform who took a portrait of the former government of Katanga, Moise Katumbi. Many youth were allegedly arrested and others wounded during the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels abmushed 6 artisanal miners near Sambia, while traveling to Dungu. They had their property stolen and were kidnapped, but 4 managed to escape.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers turned an ambush by FDLR rebels on Ishasha road in the Kitwiguru area. 5 rebels were killed during the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police forces used tear gas to disperse as many as 5,000 UNAFEC demonstrators angry at the involvement of police in interfering with their party HQ in the city and calling for the ouster of President Kabila. The protesters allegedly clashed with police, injuring 5 of them, and vandalized shops. 13 protesters were arrested. At least 1 American and 3 others foreigners were also allegedly arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with Mayi Mayi Gumino militiamen in Kajembwe in the Bijombo highlands area. 2 Gumino militiamen were killed and 5 wounded. They were also dislodged from the area.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels ambushed 6 people between Dungu and Sambia, stealing their property and forcing them to transport it before releasing them.

properties.ACTOR1: Nombe Ovungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Nombe Ovungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Two families in the Nombe Ovungu group in the Sankuru area clashed, with one person being stabbed to death, over exploitation of a forest in their area.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: The former chief of staff of Moses Katumbi of the PPRD was arrested by security forces in Lubumbashi on charges of attempting to incite a "popular uprising".

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Care workers of the MIBA hospitals in Dipumba and Bonzola engaged in a strike to demand their wages for the past three months. They also staged a sit-in.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 19 Raia Mutomboki militimane voluntarily surrendered to FARDC soldiers at a base in the Bakano sector of Walikale.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: G7 Opposition Coalition
properties.NOTES: Opposition parties held a rally in front of the Martyrs Stadium in Kinshasa. During the rally, they called for more independence for the Constitutional Court and for political change. The rally also disrupted traffic in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MR: Movement for Renewal
properties.NOTES: 2 sons of Pierre Lumbi, chairman of the MR party, a member of the G7 opposition coalition, were arrested in Lubumbashi on what Pierre Lumbi says are unfounded charges.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Employees of the General Directorate of Revenue of Mongala (DGREM) protested against the non-payment of their salaries, alongside members of the area's civil society.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Traders went on strike to denounce "the 'pressure' they suffer from the Directorate General of Taxes (DGI) for the collection of taxes... for the year 2016).

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: FARDC forces dislodged 2 armed groups, including the Gumino, from several localities in the Bijombo highlands over 2 days of fighting between Apr.26-27. The locations recovered include Mikengne, Mikarati, Muramvya, Kinyonyi, Nyawaranga, Kajembwe and Bijombo Centre. No casualties were reported.

properties.NOTES: FARDC forces dislodged 2 armed groups, including the Gumino, from several localities in the Bijombo highlands over 2 days of fighting between Apr.26-27. properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The HQ of UNADEF, a member of the G7 opposition coalition, in Lubumbashi was set on fire by a small group unidentified assailants. UNADEF activists blamed the police, but this could not be verified.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mahoro)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi Mahoro militiamen burned down the small market town of Mitamba in the Bijombo highlands during a FARDC offensive. No clashes or casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MR: Movement for Renewal
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MR: Movement for Renewal
properties.NOTES: Two groups of MR activists, supporters of the party's president and those in opposition, clashed over control of the MR's HQ in Bukavu. Police arrived an arrested 2 members of the opposition MR activists, including "the president of the Youth League of the opposition camp".

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: FARDC forces dislodged 2 armed groups, including the Gumino, from several localities in the Bijombo highlands over 2 days of fighting between Apr.26-27. The locations recovered include Mikengne, Mikarati, Muramvya, Kinyonyi, Nyawaranga, Kajembwe and Bijombo Centre. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kyakwama)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kabazimiya)
properties.NOTES: Fighters of the Raia Mutomboki Kazimoto and Kyakwama factions killed the son of the Kabazimiya Raia Mutomboki militia's leader. It was not clear whether the son was a member of his father's group or not.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: FARDC forces dislodged 2 armed groups, including the Gumino, from several localities in the Bijombo highlands over 2 days of fighting between Apr.26-27. The locations recovered include Mikengne, Mikarati, Muramvya, Kinyonyi, Nyawaranga, Kajembwe and Bijombo Centre. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed and 3 others injured during an attack by Nyatura fighters on a FARDC position in Mulamba in North Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The traditional leader of Bambu was killed by unidentified assailants in his home, before retreating without taking anything. The incident was believed to be related to a power struggle.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC forces clashed with Mayi Mayi Mahoro militiamen near Muhuzi in the Bijombo area, in an effort to dislodge them. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 4 people were killed and 6 abducted by Nyatura militiamen allied with the FDLR in Kalembe village in Walikale territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: About 300 employees of the former mining company CMSK demanded payment of their wages in arrears of 9 months.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 2 ADF rebels were killed in a clash with a FARDC patrol in the Kamungu area of Beni territory.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels have been accused of engaging in killings, lootings and extortion in the Mutanda and Kihondo groups recently (fatalities coded as 10).

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels have been accused of engaging in killings, lootings and extortion in the Mutanda and Kihondo groups recently (fatalities coded as 10).

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
properties.NOTES: Late Sunday FDLR FOCA attacked a police station, destroying it and releasing 8 inmates, as they attempted to find a young officer from their group which had been arrested. FARDC forces fought the FDLR rebels off. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi Kifuafua militiamen have recently been accused of arbitrary imprisonment, torture, imposition of taxes and illegal fines for the past 2 months in the Kiraku area of Walikale.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale
properties.NOTES: According to MONUSCO, 17 villagers from Luna in the Eringiti area were killed with axes and machetes by suspected ADF rebels. Gunfire was also reported by witnesses.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
properties.NOTES: 3 Congolese ICRC workers were kidnapped as their convoy went through the village of Kyaghala in Rutshuru. They were later released.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 1 FDLR rebel was killed during a clash with FARDC soldiers in Kaseguru, near Goma. 5 trucks were also burned during the incident. 2 civilians were also injured during the attack.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: About 100 familieis fled clashes which they fighting over the past week in the Shabunda, Mwenga and Kabare areas of South Kivu between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki-Mabala militias.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: "Dead city" protest strikes were held in Oicha, Mbau and Eringiti following the killing of 17 people in the village of Luna.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: Moses Katumbi says "since this morning my house was surrounded by security forces, four times," and that "two of [his] bodyguards were arrested at their homes." He has requested protection from MONUSCO. The day before, he officially became a candidate in the presidential election.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
