properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of the head of the National Intelligence Agency (ANR) in Kisima, Beni territory, killing him.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 9 people were killed by about a dozen ADF rebels armed with knives and guns dressed in military uniforms who attacked the locality of Ndalya and the resort of Biane in Walesse Vonkutu chieftancy in the Ituri area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: FARDC and APCLS fighters clashed in the Mweso area. The only reported casualty was a lawyer and human rights activist, Roger Muteba, who was injured and later died of his wounds.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The bodies of 3 FARDC soldiers were found beheaded in the Dungu area of Haut Uele. LRA rebels were the suspected perpetrators due to their activity in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The HQ of Sokola One was moved from Beni to the Mbau-Kamango-Eringiti area where the killing of 17 people recently occurred (coded at Eringiti as the biggest town in the area, and closest to Luna, the location of the incident).

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 30 civilians were killed between May.3-10 in the Eringiti area according to MONUSCO, by ADF rebels (17 coded in a previous event).

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: About 200 people have been arrested since the beginning of May related to "acts of insecurity" in the Rutshuru area. Most of these have been sent to the central prison in Rutshuru.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of a police official, but encountered resistance from his guards before retreating. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: During a protest against a toll barrier in the Boso-Mbubu area of Bongandanga, a woman died after police fired into the air to disperse protesters. It is not clear exactly how the death occurred, but the report said the police had been "implicated".

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Motorcyclists from Kalemie protested against the introduction of a new "toll road" by the Tanganyika Revenue Directorate. The protesters destroyed three toll gates just outside Muyumba city on the road to Lubumbashi.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels occupying in the Bwalanda area killed a man at his home. The cause of the violence was not reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A group of young people threw stones at police who were guarding the sealed HQ of UNAFEC, resulting in the police retreating from the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers regained control of several localities from unidentified Mayi Mayi militias in the Lemera area of South Kivu, including Nyanzale Ruhuba, Kabumenge, Katwenge, Bubamba, Kibanga, and Kahanda. An offensive in the area had been started on May.10. No casualties were reported.

properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels attacked military positions in Kilambo, Rutshuru, forcing FARDC soldiers to withdraw. The FDLR rebels then torched the military camp in the area and looted some houses before withdrawing. The military re-occupied the positions after the FDLR retreat.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: On May.10 it was reported that at least 30 associates of Moses Katumbi, an announced presidential contendor and former Katanga governor/PPRD member, have been arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police dispersed supporters of Moses Katumbi who arrived with him at the Lubumbashi courthouse using tear gas after Katumbi was separated from his supporters and a scuffle broke out with police.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen stole about 40 pirogues from the Visthumbi area, near Nyakakoma, and kidnapped 3 Ugandan fishermen.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: An off-duty army captain on his way to work was shot dead by unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle in the Tongo area.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers withdrew from their positions in the Bashali-Mokoto area. This resulted in allied Nyatura-FDLR fighters re-occupying parts of the territory, including Busumba, Mpati and Kivuye.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers withdrew from their positions in the Bashali-Mokoto area. This resulted in allied Nyatura-FDLR fighters re-occupying parts of the territory, including Busumba, Mpati and Kivuye.

properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers withdrew from their positions in the Bashali-Mokoto area. This resulted in allied Nyatura-FDLR fighters re-occupying parts of the territory, including Busumba, Mpati and Kivuye.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Around 500 motorcycle drivers protested on the main road of Niania, in the Isrio-Mambasa territory, over alleged demands of bribes by the Road Traffic Police (PCR). Police opened fire on the demonstrators, killing at least 4, including a student. The angry crowd then burned down houses surrounding the police station before the army arrived to disperse them. The PCR and Congolese Natonal Police commander was arrested by the military.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio France Internationale; Associated Press International
properties.NOTES: Police fired tear gas to disperse as many as several thousands supporters of Moses Katumbi outside the Lubumbashi courthouse. Police also allegedly "chased with batons dozens of lawyers" who had arrived to defend Katumbi and all others being investigated in connection to disturbances in Lubumbashi for free. Several people were arrested and transferred to Kinshasa. Moise Katumbi was admitted to hospital following the incident for "exhaustion and tear gas poisoning" and has since claimed that police "injected him with an unknown substance" in order to kill him.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: "Media houses" in Baraka were allegedly attacked by Congolese military and police forces.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: At least 5 civilians were killed by ADF rebels who attacked the Ndalia and Katabeyi localities in the Irumu area. At least 2 of these were killed in the Katabeyi health centre, which was then burned down.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces have jointly launched a large offensive against ADF rebels focusing on the Eringiti territory, following recent killings by the group.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police arrested at least 5 LUCHA activists who were part of a sit-in demonstrations outside the MONUSCO HQ in Goma against insecurity and recent attacks in Beni territory. Police allegedly beat the demonstrators as well as a MONUSCO agent who was filming the incident and 2 journalists, one of whom was a correspondent for VoA. The LUCHA activists were late released.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: At least 2 ADF rebels were killed as Congolese soldiers responded to an attack on the Ndalia and Katabeyi localities of Irumu. One rebel was also captured.

properties.NOTES: At least 5 civilians were killed by ADF rebels who attacked the Ndalia and Katabeyi localities in the Irumu area. At least 2 of these were killed in the Katabeyi health centre, which was then burned down.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Military forces withdrew from the Bashali-Mokoto area of Masisi, including Kahira specifically, leading to a large displacement of people as Nyatura militiamen occupied the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: A Congolese soldier was killed during an attack by FDLR rebels on military positions in the Kibati area of North Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Raia Mutomboki and Mayi Mayi Militia fighters stole livestock from the village of Kibombo in South Kivu and organized food collection for themselves by the population.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 5 suspected Mayi Mayi militiamen and 1 FARDC soldier were killed during an ambush by the militiamen in Tomombo village in the Mitwaba area. The sldiers were responding to reports of an attack by the militiamen.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Military forces withdrew from the Bashali-Mokoto area of Masisi, including Kahira specifically, leading to a large displacement of people as Nyatura militiamen occupied the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Private Security Forces (USA)
properties.NOTES: An American security contractor arrested in late April alleges that Congolese police interrogated and tortured him for almost 6 weeks to attempt to get him to confess that he had been hired to overthrow the government. He was released on June 8, and filed a lawsuit against the government of DR-Congo on July 29 in Washington.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 Congolese soldiers were killed and another wounded when unidentified gunmen attacked an army position in Kilimanyoka in the Nyiragongo area.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Lijoba Clan Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Over the last few weeks members of the Lijoba clan have set fire to most of the houses of the Tsoro clan in Tsoro over an ongoing conflict over land between the two clans.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Demoratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Protesters held a demonstration in Fizi and demanded benefits promised to them by the Congolese government through the National Commission for Refugees (CNR). They say they were promised compensation for land sold to make room for Burundian refugees. They blocked roads as part of their demonstrations.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers occupied the town of Kahira. They had earlier vacated it, and it was then occupied by Nyatura militiamen, but they vacated it once the army returned to the area without any violence.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
properties.NOTES: A Raia Mutomboki militia attacked the Luhago locality in Kabare territory. They looted several properties before kidnapping 5 village chiefs and demanding a ransom.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Demoratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police officers attempted to chase off illegal miners, leading to clashes. 2 police stations were attacked and prisoners freed, while some vehicles were also destroyed. 1 person was killed during the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 4 people were killed with knives by unidentified assailants in Kaselebela-Kunda village in South Maniema. One of those killed was the director of a primary school. His house was also burned down in the attack.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.NOTES: MONUSCO forces attacked ADF positions in Beni territory with artillery and helicopters. No casualties were reported.

properties.NOTES: Butembo, Lubero, Oicha, Eringeti, Mbau, and Beni have engaged in a coordinated "dead city" protest to demand an end to insecurity in North Kivu. The strike is meant to last 72 hours.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: As many as a thousand black clad protesters marched in Bukavu to show solidarity with the populations of Beni and North Kivu.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 Mayi Mayi militiamen were captured during a clash with the military in the Kibirizi area of Mutarule.

properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Congolese soldiers backed by MONUSCO have dislodged ADF rebels from several camps in the area around Beni where the "Usalama" operation is ongoing. 23 ADF rebels were also reported killed since the beginning of the operation.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: About 10 Mayi Mayi Simba militiamen attacked Etabe village and were fought off by FARDC soldiers who intervened as the group was looting the village. Two civilians are killed during the battle.]

properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Nyatura-FDLR coalition fighters attacked a FARDC position in the Kibarizo area. The clash lead to a displacement of the areas residents.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Congolese National Police dispersed a peaceful march to show solidarity with the population of Beni and North Kivu. At least 25 people were said to have been arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
properties.NOTES: 4 Ugandan police officers were killed in a gunfight on Lake Albert with FARDC soldiers. Ugandan police in the area have been accused of unlawfully taking Congolese fishing boats.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed, including one soldier and 2 wives of soldiers, and 1 soldier injured during an attack on 2 FARDC positions in the Kalehe area by Nyatura militiamen. The camps were burned and some livestock looted. The fatalities occurred at the Lumbishi camp, while 1 soldier was injured at the Tushunguti (Kisha) camp.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed, including one soldier and 2 wives of soldiers, and 1 soldier injured during an attack on 2 FARDC positions in the Kalehe area by Nyatura militiamen. The camps were burned and some livestock looted. The fatalities occurred at the Lumbishi camp, while 1 soldier was injured at the Tushunguti (Kisha) camp.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Several commercial houses in Uvira went on strike to protest against the levying of a "professional tax on the remuneration of the individual farmers".

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
properties.NOTES: The provincial president of the UNC was arrested, along with the provincial executive secretary of ECIDES, for their part in organizing a march on May 26 which has been banned.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: An Indian was attacked with fists and stones in the Gombe area of Kinshasa. It was allegedly related to the recent killing of a Congolese citizen in New Delhi.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 2 Congolese aid workers of the NGO International Solidarity were kidnapped by an unidentified group in the Lubero area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi
properties.NOTES: Demonstrations were held in Beni against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The march, which had been banned, was dispersed by police using tear gas.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Demonstrations were held in Bukavu against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protest was largely peaceful.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Bukavu against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protest was dispersed by riot police "within minutes of beginning" and the federal secretary of the UNC was allegedly "brutalized" by the police.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Union of Patriots for the Defense of the Innocents)
properties.NOTES: FARDC and UPDI Mayi Mayi fighters clashed in the Etabe area. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Goma against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. Police used tear gas to disperse the protest, which was banned, while the protesters threw stones, blocked roads and burned tires. At least one protester was also allegedly killed while trying to wrestle a rifle from a police officer, while 2 police and 5 protesters were wounded, and 20 people arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNADEF: National Union of Democrats and Federalists
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Demonstrations were held in Kalemie against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests were dispersed by the police, and were attended by UNADEF and PND members.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Kananga against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests were banned in Kananga, resulting in at least one event prevented before it could begin, and others "brutally dispersed" by the police.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Kinshasa against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests had earlier been banned. Police fired tear gas to disperse the protesters which numbered around 5,000, and the protesters responded by throwing stones, wounding as many as 35 police officers. An MP of the MLC, Eve Bazaiba, also claims to have been shot by the police during the march.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Demonstrations were held in Kalemie against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests were dispersed by the police.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Electoral Violence: Demonstrations were held in Mbandaka against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. After a 2km march the police dispersed the protesters using warning shots, causing some wounds. MLC members participated in the protest.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Demonstrations were held in Moba against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protest was dispersed by the police who fired warning shots. Some arrests were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Tsoro Clan Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Members of the Tsoro clan set fire to houses and other community buildings of the Lijoba clan in Ndrongo in the Djugu area related to an ongoing conflict over land.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes occurred between police and students of the Higher Institute of Applied Technology (ISTA) in Kinshasa. The students were protesting to demand the release of students arrested by university police on May 24 as they distributed pamphlets advertising a march by the opposition parties. At least 30 protesters were wounded during the clash, as police allegedly used live ammo alongside tear gas to disperse the students. At least 6 policemen were also injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The S40 youth organization staged a march for peace in Bukavu. The demonstrators also called for respect for constitutional electoral deadlines.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels occupied Mweso and Bukombo following FARDC soldiers withdrawal from the areas.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have retaken 4 localities in the Kalehe area from Raia Mutomboki and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen, including Chifunzi, Chaminunu, Butale and Mule. It was not clear which groups held which localities. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have retaken 4 localities in the Kalehe area from Raia Mutomboki and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen, including Chifunzi, Chaminunu, Butale and Mule. It was not clear which groups held which localities. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have retaken 4 localities in the Kalehe area from Raia Mutomboki and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen, including Chifunzi, Chaminunu, Butale and Mule. It was not clear which groups held which localities. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have retaken 4 localities in the Kalehe area from Raia Mutomboki and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen, including Chifunzi, Chaminunu, Butale and Mule. It was not clear which groups held which localities. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels occupied Mweso and Bukombo following FARDC soldiers withdrawal from the areas.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 5 people were killed when the FDLR attacked a military position in the Katwa area, near Virunga National Park. 2 of those killed were soldiers while the rest were their dependents. At least one person was seriously injured as well. The FDLR rebels also looted several houses and took livestock after the attack.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Xinhua News Agency - French
properties.NOTES: 2 teachers were killed in an ambush by ADF rebels in the Beni area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Xinhua News Agency - French
properties.NOTES: After ADF rebels killed 2 teachers, FARDC soldiers intervened and killed 2 ADF rebels before driving them off. Another civilian was killed by the ADF as they retreated.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Several young residents of Bunia staged a sit-in outside the town manager's office to denounce insecurity and demand action.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: The Nyatura-APCLS coalition occupied Kahira after FARDC soldiers withdrew from the locality.

properties.ACTOR1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ASP: Alliance for the Health of the People
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: M23: March 23 Movement
properties.NOTES: The Government of the DR-Congo has approved the launch of a political party called the  'Alliance for the Health of the People' (ASP) to replace the M23 Movement.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The Tshopo Womens' Collective staged a sit-in outside the provicinial governor's residence in Kisangani to protest the lack of female representation in the provincial government.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers have been deployed to the city of Ntoto in Walikale territory for the first time in 24 years due to ongoing security concerns in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: LRA rebels were also reported to have attacked and looted another village in Bas-Uele at the same time as their attack on Gamba in the Bili chieftancy. No details were given on the second village attacked.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Prison Guards (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Prisoners at a Bunia prison held a protest over the death of one of the inmates due to illness. FARDC soldiers were deployed to prevent a breakout, and fired into the air to disperse the protest. During the incident, at least 6 inmates were injured but it was not clear how the injuries came about.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: About 50 LRA rebels raided Gamba village in the Bili chieftancy of Bondo territory. They looted a large amount of goods, livestock and other property, and kidnapped as many as 100 people to help them carry it. Some of those kidnapped were later released.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: Thousands of supporters of President Kabila rallied in Kinshasa to mark the President's birthday. A notable in the PPRD party which supports Kabila also suggested holding a referendum to extend his rule during the event.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: The headless body of a young man was found in the Nyakunde area of Ituri. ADF rebels are reportedly suspected due to the method of execution.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A motorcyclist was killed in the Kalemie area by an unidentified assailant who was reported by a witness to be wearing a military uniform.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Over 200 families held a sit-in outside the territorial office of Kalehe. They were forced out of their homes in the Muhongoza area due to heavy rains.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers recovered 10 cows from Nyatura militiamen after a clash in the town of Chambombo in Kalehe territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed assailants stole money and phones from a dozen women in Basalolo in the Bunia area. The attackers also stole other property, kidnapped 4 women and wounded a man with a machete.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: During an attempted forced eviction of a military court magistrate by the security forces, a clash broke out between the security forces and soldiers attached to a neighbouring military court magistrate. At least 6 "members of the security forces" were arrested following the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Day labourers building homes in the River City area of Kinshasa went on strike and began a protest to demand two months of backpay.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 soldiers were arrested after allegedly raping 2 minor girls who had been serving them at a bar in the Biakato area.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: More than 4,000 demonstrators turned out in Bili to protest against a recent mass kidnapping by the LRA in the area. They staged a sit-in in front of some residences that house FARDC officers in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A police officer shot a young man in the leg, allegedly on the orders of the territory administrator, after he had been arrested and handcuffed in Ekombe. The police officer was later arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen raided the village of Apinzi in Basili chiefdom in the Ituri area. They fired their guns into the areas, stole livestock, killed other animals, and attempted to kidnap the head of the village but did not succeed.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: About 50 former cabinet ministers of the outgoing government of Oriental province protested at the Place des Martyrs in Kisangani against the alleged "hijacking" of 150 million Congolese francs meant to clear salary arrears and allowances.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A demonstration was on 30 June Boulevard against increases to the cost of internet across the country. 4 journalists covering the event were arrested, but later released after the intervention of the DRC National Press Union.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 NDC-C fighters were killed, one wounded, and 3 captured during actions as part of Operation Sokola 2 over the weekend in Walikale territory. One of those killed was allegedly the deputy leader.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Radio Okapi; The Daily Monitor
properties.NOTES: 6 ADF rebels and 1 FARDC soldier were killed in a clash between the Kokola and Parking areas. At least 2 soldiers was also wounded and 2 ADF rebels captured. Artillery fire was heard during the clashes. The deputy commander of the ADF, Hood Lukwago, was among those killed.

properties.ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR rebels have engaged in "abuses against the indigenous peoples" of the Buleusa area in Walikale territory recently after moving into the area. At least one person was reported killed on Jun.13.

properties.ACTOR1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 6 people were killed and 3 wounded in clashes between the Nande and Hutu communities due to the alleged kidnapping of a Nande by Hutu in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. 5 of those killed were Hutu IDPs while 1 Nande was also reported killed and an IDP camp burned. The violence was allegedly also related to reports that FDLR combatants were active in the IDP camp in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Prison Guards (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: During an escape from Boma prison by 26 inmates, prison guards shot one, seriously injuring him.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 14 FARDC soldiers and 37 ADF rebels have been killed in operations against the ADF since May (the deaths of 6 ADF rebels and 1 soldier coded in another event). 15 other rebels were captured, along with weapons and ammunitions and some roadside bombs. MONUSCO supported FARDC in these operations. One of the ADF rebels killed was the 2nd in command of the group (killed on June 13, coded in another event).

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Prisoners of the Dungu Central Prison rioted after the death of an inmate, leading to clashes with the prison guards. The administrator of Dungu territory says that the clashes were related to prisoners demands for improvement of conditions within the prison.

properties.ACTOR1: Goma Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Youth self-defense groups have begun night patrols in Goma due to ongoing insecurity in the area due to bandits. They are allegedly engaging in vigilante actions against the bandits.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: M23: March 23 Movement
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service; Al Jazeera (Doha)
properties.NOTES: At least 11 people were killed and others wounded as clashes broke out between demobilized combatants and FARDC soldiers in Kamina. The FARDC soldiers allegedly opened fire on thousands of demobilized M23 combatants who were protesting against the delays surrounding their reintegration by the military authorities, killing at least 10 and wounding 4. A FARDC officer was also killed with a machete by the former combatants, and 4 other soldiers wounded. The former combatants allegedly tried to invade and loot the Kamina city centre.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: A Mayi Mayi militia has moved into the area near Lake Edward following a withdrawal of FARDC soldiers. They are reported to have been attacking the population, including shooting a young man for refusing to pay a toll to access the lake.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Cases of "ambushes, cattle theft, illegal collection of taxes, rape, looting and killings" have been reported to authorities in the Lubondja area between May-July 2016. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. The area is known to be a haven for FNL/Mayi Mayi groups.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed by gunmen (believed to be part of a network of shepherds who have been involved in attacks in the area) in Nyabibwe in the Kalehe area during the month of June.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: At least 85 people have been kidnapped from Goma since the beginning of 2016, many of whom (specifically young men) have allegedly been sold to rebels groups, specifically the ADF, who in turn sell them to other "Muslim groups" based on the reports of Let's Uproot Human Trafficking, an NGO based in the Eastern DRC.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 soldiers were killed during an ambush on the Shanje-Chambombo axis in the Kalehe area. A group of 7 gunmen from the Nyatura Mayi Mayi group were responsible.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: A woman was killed in the fields of the village of Biinja in the Kalembe area by FDLR-Nyatura coalition fighters.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers regained control of Peti village from NDC-R fighters who withdrew without a fight.

properties.ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: At least 7 NDC-R militiamen were killed and 11 others wounded in a clash with South African MONUSCO peacekeepers  and FARDC soldiers in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. They were allegedly trying to prevent food distribution to IDPs.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 20 teachers from a Kisangani primary school protested to demand the provincial authorities intervene to secure 8 months backpay they are waiting on.

properties.ACTOR1: Ntambwe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Kamalu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: After a conflict broke out between the Ntambwe and Kamalu communities, residents of Ntambwe went to Kamalu village with the body of a compatriot that was killed in the clash, burned houses and injured 6 people, 3 seriously.

properties.ACTOR1: Ntambwe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Kamalu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 1 Ntambwe man was killed and 2 others seriously injured during a clash between Kamalu and Ntambwe people related to a dispute over land in the Dibaya area.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Security forces arrested a provincial deputy and 74 others accused of belonging to a militia, "Djeshi ya Yesu" (Jesus' Army) which had been involved in killings and mass rapes in South Kivu province. Their alleged leader Frederic Batumike is specifically accused of ordering the murder of a human rights activist, Walter Mueller, in 2012.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Moses Katumbi, an opposition candidate for president, was sentenced to 3 years in jail over a property dispute.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: More than 3,000 students from the Higher Trades Institute (SAI) protested and threw projectiles at university personnel and vehicles after the "omission of their names on the final list of the establishment" despite paying academic fees.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers dismantled an FDLR position in the Kazaroho area during operations supported by MONUSCO. They also captured arms and released 6 people kidnapped on the Kibirizi-Rwindi road.

properties.ACTOR1: Government of United States
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The United States announced sanctions on the head of the Kinshasa police. According to the US Treasury, "General Clestin Kanyama is 'responsible or complicit in acts of violence and kidnappings (...) targeting of civilians, women and children".

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Thierry Mukelekele, spokesman and confidante of the NDC-G leader, was arrested in Lubumbashiafter delivering a "message of peace" whose contents was not revealed by the authorities.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: A Mayi Mayi group from North Kivu raided the Muchacha mining area, demanding food from the miners working there before leaving the area.

properties.ACTOR1: NDRC: National Council for Democratic Renewal
properties.NOTES: A new rebel group composed of former M23 and FDLR-FOCA/RUDI faction fighters, called the National Council for Democratic Renewal (NDRC), has been formed in the Rutshuru area, specifically in and around the Bwito Chiefdom. Le Potentiel reported that they are planning a major attack on Butembo.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified militiamen raided Sidabo village in the Walendu Bindi area. A woman injured during the raid later died of her injuries.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 10 FRPI militiamen were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers in the village of Kienge in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom. 2 soldiers were seriously wounded in the clash which began as the soldiers attempted to dismantle militia positions.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Manu)
properties.NOTES: Manu and Sumbadede Mayi Mayi militiamen fought between June.27-28 over a mining site in the Muchacha area of the Okapi Wildlife Reserve.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Unidentified gunmen raided Kailenge village in the Walikale area. During the attack they clashed with FARDC soldiers who forced them to retreat. One soldier was wounded in the battle.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Manu)
properties.NOTES: Manu and Sumbadede Mayi Mayi militiamen fought between June.27-28 over a mining site in the Muchacha area of the Okapi Wildlife Reserve.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 13 Nyatura militiamen attacked a FARDC position in Kavumu in South Kivu. Both groups clashed with heavy weapons.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: An attack by the FRPI on military positions in the village of Kiboba in the Walendu Bidni area resulted in a soldier and a militiamen killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: At least 3 clashes occurred between FDLR and FARDC forces in the Bwito chieftancy in the Rutshuru area. These included 2 killed and 4 injured in Katsiro locality and 2 killed in the Bishusha area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: At least 3 clashes occurred between FDLR and FARDC forces in the Bwito chieftancy in the Rutshuru area. These included 2 killed and 4 injured in Katsiro locality and 2 killed in the Bishusha area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The body of a uniformed FARDC soldier was found in the N'Djili river in Kinshasa on Jun.30.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
properties.NOTES: The NDC-R and NDC-C militias clashed in the Mironge and Taka villages of Mutongo locality. 2 NDC-R fighters were reported killed during the clash.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Following a death of a prisoner in the custody of the Congolese national police, residents of Kafe burned the offices and buildings belonging to members of the security forces. They also took three women police officers and their dependents hostage, saying they will be released once the cause of the prisoner's death was clarified.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 miners were injured in clashes with guards of a COMIDE mining site in Lenga, in Lualaba province, during a riot after they were denied access despite promises by the provincial government.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Xinhua News Agency - French
properties.NOTES: 9 civilians were killed by suspected ADF rebels in the Tenambo, Nzanza and Mamiki localities of Oicha.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped four police officer's spouses and 3 children after a weapons cache of theirs was captured by FARDC soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers secured the release of spouses and children of police officers who had been kidnapped by Mayi Mayi militia after the soldiers pursued and tracked down the kidnappers.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Traders in Kinshasa protested in and around the city's central market over the murder of a Congolese national in India. Many shops remained closed and police were deployed to prevent retaliation against the Indian population of the city. There were some reports of attacks against Indian shops.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftancy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftancy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftancy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Reports of attacks against Indian shops have continued following the murder of a Congolese national in India. Police forces have had to intervene and place Indian shops under their protection.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftancy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: LRA: Lord's Resistance Army
properties.NOTES: Suspected LRA poachers kidnapped 8 people in an attack on Ongonga village in Bafakoi area of Wamba territory. They also raped people, looted the village, and wounded 2 people with gunfire. The kidnapped people were made to carry the property stolen by the assailants.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 5 soldiers traveling near Kalera fell into an ambush set by Mayi Mayi militiamen, forcing them to retreat.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After following some soldiers they had ambushed to Kalera, some Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked the city, killing 4 people and beheading a policeman.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A youth group from Mahagi protested to oppose the arrests of 4 journalists and some human rights activists in the village of Zengu.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed groups carried out attacks on 8 villages in the Onimba locality between Walikale and Lubero in the Usala group between Jul.3-13, resulting in 5,000 inhabitants fleeing their homes due to insecurity. Homes, schools, churches and health centres were burned during the attacks. The areas affected are localities of Mubi, Kilambo, Njingala and Boboro.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.ACTOR2: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: 4 people, including a MONUSCO peacekeeper, were injured in a clash between the NDC-R and the FDLR-Nyatura-APCLS coalition in Kikuku that was then broken up by MONUSCO forces who intervened to protect the population of the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed groups carried out attacks on 8 villages in the Onimba locality between Walikale and Lubero in the Usala group between Jul.3-13, resulting in 5,000 inhabitants fleeing their homes due to insecurity. Homes, schools, churches and health centres were burned during the attacks. The areas affected are localities of Mubi, Kilambo, Njingala and Boboro.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 13 people were wounded during a fight between two groups of students from the University of Kisangani over use of communal spaces. Police attempted to disperse two groups of clashing Kisangani students with tear gas and aerial firing but were unable to deter them.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed groups carried out attacks on 8 villages in the Onimba locality between Walikale and Lubero in the Usala group between Jul.3-13, resulting in 5,000 inhabitants fleeing their homes due to insecurity. Homes, schools, churches and health centres were burned during the attacks. The areas affected are localities of Mubi, Kilambo, Njingala and Boboro.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: Fighting has been reported between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyanzale area, leading to displacement.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Fighting has been reported between unidentified Mayi Mayi militias in the Nyanzale area, leading to displacement.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Armed groups carried out attacks on 8 villages in the Onimba locality between Walikale and Lubero in the Usala group between Jul.3-13, resulting in 5,000 inhabitants fleeing their homes due to insecurity. Homes, schools, churches and health centres were burned during the attacks. The areas affected are localities of Mubi, Kilambo, Njingala and Boboro.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 2 suspected ADF gunmen wearing old Ugandan military uniforms were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers near the border village of Kotongo.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The residence of about 100 Faculty of Agricultural Sciences Institute of Yangambi students was burned down after the resumption of clashes between students of that institution and the University of Kisangani. It was not clear if a clash accompanied the arson, and no casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: The staff of the Cinquantenaire hospital in Kinshasa went on strike to demand the payments of months of backpay.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: CF: Citizen Front
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Several members of Citizen Front, the G7, and other groups were arrested during a sit-in outside the office of the provincial assembly of Tshopo in Kisangani. They were demanding the release of a member of Citizen Front who had been arrested on Friday.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: 17 people were abducted by 10 FRPI militiamen during raids on the localities of Mandibe 1 and 2 near Komanda in Ituri territory. A man was shot and two women raped during the assault.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After FRPI kidnapped 17 people in a raid in the Mandibe localities, FARDC soldiers intervened and freed some of the hostages during a clash with the FRPI.

properties.ACTOR1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
properties.NOTES: Fighting was reported between NDC-R and Nyatura forces in the Buluma area of Rutshuru.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Militia (Mangalibi Sadala)
properties.NOTES: A coalition of three Mayi Mayi militias (Simba, Mangalibi and Simon) have occupied the mining area of Muchacha in the Okapi Wildlife Reserve in Ituri territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: FDLR forces attacked a FARDC position in the Tongo-Rusheshe area of Rutshuru territory, resulting in 1 soldier and 1 FDLR rebel dead and 2 others injured. The FARDC soldiers were forced into a temporary withdrawal which allowed the FDLR rebels to burn their camp before the soldiers were able to return with reinforcements the next morning.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Bakabeya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Members of the Bakabeya clan allegedly attacked members of a rival clan in the Kisiki locality, stealing their property, burning their houses, and assaulting them during the incident. About 150 people were displaced as a result of the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: JUNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Youth
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: JUNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Youth
properties.NOTES: A group of JUNAFEC members armed with knives attacked fellow members of their party associated with a different faction, resulting in serious injuries. Some of those involved were later arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
properties.NOTES: 2 youths were killed in the Rutshuru area during fighting between Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen and another unidentified Mayi Mayi militia.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.NOTES: 50 people, including the South African contingent of MONUSCO and members of the Volunteer Association of the Congo (ASVOCO), took part in a peace march in Goma ahead of Nelson Mandela Day.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Guards of Okapi National Park
properties.NOTES: One assailant was killed and others injured in Katala, Mambasa in a clash between park rangers and poachers who were allegedly attempting to kidnap the territory's administrator and employees of an NGO. Both LRA rebels and South Sudanese soldiers are known to poach in DR-Congo's national parks.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.SOURCE: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: At least 4 Hutu were killed during an alleged attack by armed Nande on the Hutu population of the Kibirizi area of Rutshuru.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A Mayi Mayi militia invaded the town of Kalera in order to release some of their colleagues. However, they had already been transferred, so the militiamen burned down the police station and then shot and beheaded a soldier.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 7 people were killed, including at least 6 members of the Nande ethnic group, and 5 others wounded when suspected Nyatura-FDLR coalition fighters (also described as armed Hutu) attacked the Nande population of the Kibirizi area of Rutshuru. Huts were also reportedly burned down. Some sources described the event as a clash between Hutu and Nande, although civilians appear to have made up all the fatalities. The attack was allegedly in response to an attack by Nande on Hutus on Jul.17. FARDC soldiers intervened to end the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Kasongo Faction
properties.NOTES: Two Nyatura militias, one led by Colonel Kasongo and the other by General Benjamin, clashed in the Kivuye area of Bashali Mokoto following the pullout of FARDC from the area. One of the militias managed to caputre the area from the other.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A civilian accused of colluding with those responsible for a recent attack on Kibirizi was stoned and killed by Kibirizi youths.

properties.ACTOR1: FOREBU: Republican Forces of Burundi
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: FOREBU rebels attacked a FARDC position in Madjaga village in the Uvira area.

properties.ACTOR1: FOREBU: Republican Forces of Burundi
properties.NOTES: FOREBU rebels have allegedly been recruiting in the Bijombo area, specifically in the villages of Chanzovu, Kagogo and Kateja.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Raia Tujigemeye)
properties.NOTES: A newly created "Nyatura" militia, Raia Tujigemeye, has occupied Butale in the Bashali Mokoto grouping.

properties.ACTOR1: PERCI: Civilian Personnel of the Military
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Between Jul.18-23 three cases of "torture and extortion of property" were recorded by the "PERCI", a civilian paramilitary unit organized by the military. On Jul.20 a farmer was beaten and had a bag of rice stolen in Mbulula, while 2 other incidents occurred in Kahenye and Sayi, all in the Kongolo (Tanganyika) area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 1 person was killed and 5 others injured after militiamen attacked a truck in the Kyanyunda locality in South Kivu. One of those injured later died in hospital. The attackers had been robbing some motorcyclists before the truck showed up and they started shooting.

properties.ACTOR1: PERCI: Civilian Personnel of the Military
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Between Jul.18-23 three cases of "torture and extortion of property" were recorded by the "PERCI", a civilian paramilitary unit organized by the military. On Jul.20 a farmer was beaten and had a bag of rice stolen in Mbulula, while 2 other incidents occurred in Kahenye and Sayi, all in the Kongolo (Tanganyika) area.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 3 Mayi Mayi militiamen were killed in a clash with Congolese soldiers in the Busafa village, Mitwaba.

properties.ACTOR1: PERCI: Civilian Personnel of the Military
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Between Jul.18-23 three cases of "torture and extortion of property" were recorded by the "PERCI", a civilian paramilitary unit organized by the military. On Jul.20 a farmer was beaten and had a bag of rice stolen in Mbulula, while 2 other incidents occurred in Kahenye and Sayi, all in the Kongolo (Tanganyika) area.

properties.ACTOR1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed, including a civilian, in a clash between the APCLS and Raia Tujigemeye Nyatura groups in Butale. The APCLS managed to dislodge the Raia Tujigemeye group from the village.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After a man died of his injuries following a beating by police, an angry mob ransacked and burned a police station in Miabi

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 6 people were killed by unidentified assailants using machetes in the Bwalanda area of North Kivu. At least 3 were burned to death in their homes.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: During an arrest, the son of a police commander slapped a villager who was angry about the police action, leading to a clash between residents of the area and the police, with anger specifically directed at the police commander's son.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked a passenger vehicle in the Matafa area of the Walendu Bindi chieftancy, injuring at least 3 traders and stealing goods.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: The Congolese army and MONUSCO launched a military operation, named "Kiboko 3" against the FRPI in south Irumu, including the use of air support.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Motorcycle taxi drivers staged a protest-strike in Kisangani against alleged arbitrary arrests and harassment against them by agents of the city's traffic police. They built a barricade on roads leading to the city centre and allegedly trashed a police station and some businesses. Some protesters engaging in a march were also dispersed by police using tear gas. At some point during the events, 3 protesters were allegedly killed during clashes with police along with several injured, including policemen. The police allegedly opened fire on the protesters.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The leader of a Raia Mutomboki faction, Simuzizi Labani, was shot in the head and a child wounded in a clash with Congolese soldiers in the Luberizi area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.NOTES: A trader was killed and 3 others injured in a suspected attack by suspected Burundian militiamen in the Uvira area.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Fangasa, near Aveba, killing a woman accused of collaborating with FARDC and looted property.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police and UDPS supporters clashed in Lubumbashi's Matshipisha neighbourhood. No other details were given.

properties.ACTOR1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
properties.NOTES: FRPI militiamen attacked the village of Mayimbi, near Aveba, killing a woman.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: A march in support of dialogue was called by President Kabila in Gbadolite. The march included members of the provincial government, MLAs, officials and activists of the party of the presidential majority.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police and UDPS supporters clashed in Lubumbashi's Matshipisha neighbourhood as UDPS activists gathered to discuss and celebrate the return of their leader Tshisekedi. 4 people were arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: The governor of Kasai-Oriental held a march in support of political dialogue in DR-Congo, which included members of the presidential majority.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A position of the army was attacked by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Charles Kakule. The militiamen forced the military out of their camp and wounded a woman. A soldier is also MIA after the action. The military re-occupied their position after the events.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: The presidential majority held a rally in the capital to support the political dialogue announced by President Kabila. Many MPs and activists of the PPRD were present. As many as 40,000 people attended.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Congolese soldiers attacked a camp of international poachers in the Niangara area who have allegedly carried out attacks on the local population. Both South Sudanese soldiers and LRA rebels have been known to poach in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.NOTES: 7 people were killed in an attack by the ADF on Oicha, which was repulsed by Congolese soldiers and MONUSCO peacekeepers. Among those killed were 2 civilians, 3 attackers and 2 soldiers. A MONUSCO peacekeeper was also wounded and 3 ADF rebels captured.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A military magistrate was beaten by the personal guard of the commander of the Sokola 1 operation after the magistrate ordered the arrest of two Sokola 1 soldiers for allegedly trying to steal a large amount of military rations which were found in their homes. He was also held by the military intelligence service for 4 hours before being released.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: The OCR staged a rally to protest against a potential third term for President Kabila near Kinshasa's Martyrs Stadium which reportedly attracted thousands and included a speech by leading opposition figure Etienne Tshisekedi in which he demanded elections be held by the end of 2016. Police were present during the rally, which later turned into a march, but only minor incidents occurred and no injuries were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.NOTES: Activists of the various political parties making up the Rally of the Opposition coalition rallied in front of the UDPS HQ in Mbuji Mayi.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Congolese soldiers re-occupied the Mwalika area, an ADF stronghold whose population had been forced to grow food for them, without a fight.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
