properties.SOURCE: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English; Agence France Presse
properties.NOTES: At least 1 person was killed in clashes between UDPS supporters and police forces in Kinshasa. The fight allegedly started when a police officer was passing the UDPS HQ and was attacked by activists, which led to the officer firing into the crowd while trying to escape. During the incident a bus was torched; police also used tear gas to try to disperse the crowds. There was also an unverified report that a police officer was killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A miner was allegedly killed by police after being pursued by them for a minor debt in Kpangba, in the Bunia area.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: After a new head of the locality from a local family was allegedly appointed in Ngwa, in the Kongolo area of Tanganyika, the situation was disputed by another family and a brawl broke out, which included the use of machetes. Many people were wounded and houses were destroyed. The two families have been in competition for power in the area for months.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A Mayi Mayi militia killed an IDP in the Kibirizi area.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Hundreds of miners took to the streets in Mungwalu, in the Bunia area, to protest the killing of a miner, allegedly by the police who were pursuing her over a small debt. The miners attacked a police station causing the police to flee, but they later returned and fired shots into the air to disperse the protesters.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Kabamba (Kabare) attacked a police station over accusations that police failed to intervene in a robbery that led to a woman's death. The residents blockaded the main road to Bukavu/Kalehe/Goma. Police were unable to disperse the protesters despite reinforcements from Kavumu.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: PPRD: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
properties.NOTES: The PPRD organized a march in Lubumbashi to support the "inclusive national dialogue" launched by President Kabila.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A soldier and a civilian were killed by unidentified assailants in Kahunga.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: At least 4 civilians were killed by unidentified gunmen in the Kashalira area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were found dead in the Nyanzale area of Kibirizi, at least one of the bodies was that of a Nyatura fighter who had been burned alive in his home.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Mayi Mayi militiamen set fire to the Ngoroba IDP camp in the Mazembe area of Rutshuru. The inhabitants fled the area and no casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: At least 7 people were killed and hundreds of homes burned in a raid allegedly by FDLR-Nyatura coalition militiamen on Kibanda.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A soldier was killed and 3 others wounded by a Mayi Mayi militia attack in the village of Tomombo in Mitwaba.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: UDR: Union of Republicans
properties.NOTES: The national president of the UDR was abducted by armed men wearing military uniforms in the municipality of N'Djili.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 7 civilians were killed in an attack on Kibirizi by Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen. Congolese forces arrived during the attack and fought them off.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
properties.NOTES: A suspected member of the Mazembe Mayi Mayi militia was killed by Nyatura fighters.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 11 FARDC soldiers and a MONUSCO peacekeeper were wounded during operations against ADF rebels in the Beni area. A helicopter dispatched to recover the wounded came under fire and had to turn back. They were successfully evacuated the next day.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: About 100 youths demonstrated outside the offices of the representative of the AU in the Gombe commune of Kinshasa to support the inclusion of the representative in the "political dialogue" called by the president.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: PNC officers arrested 9 young people who were demanding that they be allowed to participate in the "political dialogue" called by the president. The officers allegedly beat some local people during the arrest.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Youths from the Masisi area have set up roadblocks on the road between Masisi and Goma in order to prevent humanitarian work in the area, which contains 30 IDP sites. They accused the NGOs of not living up to the expectations of the population, lacking transparency in their use of funds, and having failed to recruit enough local staff.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
properties.NOTES: The youth wing of the MLC held a demonstration and burned tires in front of the office of the federation of the new province of Ecuador in Mbandaka. The youths disapprove of the current federal committee.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Lawyers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Lawyers in Mbuji-Maya organized a march to request the lifting of immunity for an MP accused of beating up one of their colleagues.

properties.ACTOR1: Dibaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 9 people were killed in Tshimbulu in an attack by a new militia created by Kamwina Nsapu, the chief of the territory of Dibaya. The attack started with an assault on the residence of the chief of police, where his bodyguard was killed. They then set fire to the police headquarters, the CENI office, the mayor's house and other buildings, before killing 4 police offices and wounding 2 others. 4 militiamen were also killed during the incident. The militia was allegedly created to rid Kasai-Central of law enforcement personnel who harass the population.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.NOTES: Several properties in the Mvula area of Mitwaba were raided by Mayi Mayi militiamen, who fired shots into the air to scare the villagers away.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: FARDC soldiers backed by MONUSCO have engaged in clashes with ADF rebels in the south Eringeti area since the beginning of an operation against them on Aug.8, which has resulted in an unconfirmed number of ADF rebels killed (coded as 10). 3 soldiers were also killed, and another 3 wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Foreign ministry officials began a "dry strike" to claim recognition of the "status of diplomats and equitable sharing of passport and visa receipts".

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Over 200 students from the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences Institute of Yangambi in Kisangani demanded the rehabilitation of a dormitory they had been housed. The dormitory was burned down in July by University of Kisangani students.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Kashusha barricaded the main road leading to the Kavumu airport to protest the killing of 3 people during a robbery the day before, and a growing sense of insecurity in the area due to banditry.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
properties.NOTES: The commander of the FDLR-FOCA was captured by FARDC at Katiru in Rutshuru territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A group of 6 assailants armed with guns and machetes attacked a group of Nyabibwe residents returning from the Kiburi mining site, killing 1. They are believed to be part of a network of shepherds from the Kalehe highlands who often attacked residents of the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Okito Dimba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Lotelama Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: At least 15 people were killed and 60 houses burnt in a clash between two rival camps of the ruling family in the villages of Okitodimba and Lotelama in the Okolongo sector of Sankuru.

properties.ACTOR1: Dibaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 11 policemen and 9 members of Kamwina Nsapu's (Jean-Pierre Pangi) militia, including the leader himself, were killed in a clash with police in the Tshimbulu area which was allegedly started by Nsapu's militia. 4 other police are missing, while 40 militiamen were captured during the fighting.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Official sources claim at least 42 civilians were killed (civil society sources in Beni say 51) with machetes by suspected ADF rebels in an overnight attack on the Rwangoma neighbourhood of Beni territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Nyabibwe captured 6 gunmen and relieved them of their weapons following an attack on a group of Nyabibwe residents who had been returning from a mining site. The gunmen were handed over to FARDC.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Official sources claim at least 42 civilians were killed (civil society sources in Beni say 51) with machetes by suspected ADF rebels in an overnight attack on the Rwangoma neighbourhood of the territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed and several injured in an attack by unidentified assailants at Runingu market in South Kivu. The mastermind of the attack was later arrested at Kavimvira on the border between Burundi and DR-Congo.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.NOTES: Pro-Bruno Mavungu activists (the former secretary general of the UDPS) and youth members of the UDPS clashed outside their party's former HQ in the Limete commune of Kinshasa. At least 2 people were injured in the fight. The youth members of the UDPS were allegedly armed with machetes and iron bars and were accused of being sent by Felix Tshisekedi to disrupt the Mavungu supporters meeting.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 Hutu residents of Nyanale were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi militiamen from their fields near Nyanzale. They were allegedly found dead in Katwe, near Nyanzale, a few days later.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 6 FDLR rebels and 14 local fighters aligned with the FDLR were killed during clashes with Congolese soldiers during August as part of the Sokola II operation (the 6 rebel deaths coded in another event). 10 fighters were also arrested and 7 others were sent to the UN mission.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed in an attack by suspected ADF rebels in Mayimoya in the Oicha area.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 members of the Catholic NGO Caritas were kidnapped as their convoy passed through the Mpati area of the Bashali-Mokoto grouping in the Masisi area. A second vehicle escaped although it was fired upon, resulting in wounds to a German journalist. The hostages were later released after a ransom was paid.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: 80 ADF rebels were arrested in Beni territory by FARDC in connection with the capture of an Imam who was engaged in youth recruitment in the area.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A woman accused of being part of the ADF was beaten to death and had her body set on fire by residents of Beni during protests against ADF attacks in the territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Xinhua General News Service; Radio France Internationale; Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: Thousands of demonstrators protested in Beni against insecurity in their territory following the killing of more than 40 civilians by suspected ADF rebels in Rwangoma and a smaller attack in Mayi moya the day before. The protesters raised barricades and clashed with police who used tear gas to attempt to disperse them, and later soldiers who reinforced them. At least 2 people, including a protester who died of a gunshot wound and a police officer, were reported killed and 5 wounded in the violence. At least some of those injured were hit by gunshots.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse -- English
properties.NOTES: People marched from Butembo to Beni to protest against insecurity in their territory. Once they arrived these protesters were blocked outside the city by security forces while clashes occurred in Beni between protesters and security forces there (it was not clear if these protesters became involved in the clashes between protesters and police in Beni).

properties.ACTOR1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Hunde Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 4 Hutu residents of Bwalanda were killed when Nande and Hunde groups from the Nyanzale area went to the village and burned houses belonging to Hutu. The body of one of those killed was found the next day.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: After the bodies of 3 Hutu residents of Nyanzale were found dead, Hutu in the area rioted and burned the houses of Nande and Hunde in the area who they accuse of being behind the killings.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: In response to an attack on Bwalanda by Nande and Hunde, Hutu residents of Nyanzale burned most of the remaining Nande/Hunde houses in the town (rioting had led to arson attacks earlier in the week).

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Beni and Butembo protested in the night of Aug.19 against the curfews that have been called in their two cities following violent protests on Aug.17. Police attempted to disperse the protesters but were unable given the large numbers.

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A man was beaten to death by youths who took him for a thief. The police were able to save the man as the youths were attempting to burn him alive, but he later died in hospital.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Beni and Butembo protested in the night of Aug.19 against the curfews that have been called in their two cities following violent protests on Aug.17. Police attempted to disperse the protesters but were unable given the large numbers.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes broke out between police and UDPS activists who were celebrating the appointment of a new Secretary-General of their party after police attempted to disperse their march. At least 6 people who had scuffled with a police officer were arrested, while 6 protesters were wounded.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Revival of Outrage
properties.NOTES: A pro-democracy movement "Revival of Outrage"  held a protest outside the INEC offices in Bukavu. About 20 of the protesters stormed the offices and disrupted work with whistles and makeshift drums to demand the holding of elections.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: A FARDC colonel was killed by unidentified assailants in Bukavu following a trial in which he was accused of failing to protect victims in a conflict between Banyamulenge communities. He was murdered despite the presence of a bodyguard.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After police arrested 13 Hutu traveling from Masisi to Bunia in Butembo for possessing machetes and axes in their luggage, young people in Butembo gathered and demanded access to the defendants. The police dispersed them with aerial firing, injuring a demonstrator. The youths then barricaded major roads in Butembo with burning tires and marched on the residence of the mayor of Butembo before again being dispersed by police and FARDC personnel.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.NOTES: Young people from various civic movements, civil society organizations and political parties, including the UDPS, protested in Beni to demand "the immediate resignation" of President Kabila and the government.

properties.ACTOR1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.SOURCE: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio Okapi
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed in a machete attack by suspected ADF rebels in the Kiteya and Makulu areas, 20km from Beni. 6 others were wounded, while 7 houses were burned down and 4 motorcycles torched.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Police used aerial firing to disperse a group of youths who were blockading roads and burning tires around the UDPS HQ. The UDPS HQ was later surrounded by security forces. It was not clear what touched off the incident.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.NOTES: The "dead city" protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was not very well attended in Bukavu, but a protest was lodged to demand "respect for constitutional deadlines".

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A man was burned alive by residents of Butembo after he was accused of being a member of the ADF.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua General News Service
properties.NOTES: The "dead city" protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was well-attended in Goma.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua General News Service; Le Potentiel (Kinshasa)
properties.NOTES: The "dead city" protest called by the OCR against the political dialogue and to signal their rejection of the AU appointed mediator, the former Togolese Prime Minister Edem Kodjo, was well-attended in Kinshasa with a noticeable slowdown. Some barricades were also set up but were quickly dismantled by the security forces. At least 32 arrests were reported across Mbuji Mayi and Kinshasa during the "dead city" protest.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The OCR's "dead city" protest strike to show their opposition to the political dialogue called by President Kabila was not well-attended in Lubumbashi, although some barricades were raised and then quickly dismantled by police.

properties.ACTOR1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Les Dpches de Brazzaville
properties.NOTES: The APCLS and Nyatura Mayi Mayi militia, two groups active in Masisi, have signed a peace agreement, committing to end kidnappings in the area and returning police stations occupied by the militias. The agreement was negotiated with the help of MPs from the Masisi area and the security forces. They also agreed to disarm and hand their weapons to the Congolese military.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Xinhua General News Service
properties.NOTES: 2 people were injured, including a police officer, when unidentified assailants threw a molotov cocktail at a TRANSCO bus in Kinshasa during the "dead city" protest strike.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.NOTES: Mbuji Mayi was largely shut down and some tires were burned to blockade streets in response to a "dead city" protest called by the Rally for the Opposition to reject the political dialogue called by President Kabila. A motorcycle was also burnt. At least 32 arrests were reported across Mbuji Mayi and Kinshasa during the "dead city" protest.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Youth demonstrators threw stones while police used aerial firing to disperse them in Butembo following the killing of two women by a self-defense militia after they were accused of being members of the ADF. At least 57 people were allegedly arrested in relation to the killings and subsequent rioting.

properties.ACTOR1: Vigilante Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Youth members of a self-defense militia in Butembo captured two women who had just arrived in the town by mini-bus and burned them alive after accusing them of being ADF rebels.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Nearly 500 physicians observed a sit-in before the Office of the General Secretariat for Public Health in Kinshasa to demand their risk premiums.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A trader and his wife were wounded by gunfire in the Mirindi area when armed men wearing military uniforms broke into their house and robbed them.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
properties.NOTES: Local sources reported  that a unit of the Ugandan army has established its position in recent weeks in the locality of Tshogo in the full gorilla reserve of Sarambwe in Rutshuru (North Kivu). No incidents were reported while the agenda of the soldiers remains unknown.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Traders in Mambasa enaged in a protest strike against insecurity in the area after recent attacks on residents and traders.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: More than 800 state employees, mostly health professionals, protested in Mbandaka to demand payment of their salaries.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.NOTES: 3 people were killed and many abducted in an attack by Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen near a mining site in the Muchacha area of Mambasa. The attackers engaged in systematic looting of the area, used the hostages to transport the goods, and raped 4 women who were also kidnapped.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Several villages, including Kambi ya Miba, Totolito and Mbau, about 40km northeast of Beni, have been recaptured by Congolese forces. A FARDC colonel claimed that 70 casualties had been taken in one day to capture Kambi ya Miba. No other casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 people were killed and at least 5 wounded in an attack on the largely Hutu inhabited Kyuto village in Lubero by Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen which was opposed by FARDC. The militiamen also burned at least 50 houses before being repulsed by Congolese soldiers.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
properties.NOTES: Several villages, including Kambi ya Miba, Totolito and Mbau, about 40km northeast of Beni, have been recaptured by Congolese forces. A FARDC colonel claimed that 70 casualties (not clear whether any fatalities) had been taken in one day to capture Kambi ya Miba. No other casualties were reported.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
properties.NOTES: 6 FDLR rebels were killed and 5 captured during an operation which lasted from Aug.25-31 in the Bwito area of Rutshuru territory.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A 5-vehicle convoy traveling along the Bunia-Mahagi road, including FARDC soldiers, was ambushed by unidentified gunmen at Panduru bridge about 20km from Mahagi.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: After police attempted to disperse a rally by one of the members of the OCR (ENVOL) with tear gas, clashes broke in the Kenya area of Lubumbashi. Vehicles were burned during the incidents and a number of injuries were reported among both the protesters and the police. At least 12 people were arrested during the clashes.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Recipients of a recent presidential pardon protested in the central prison of Kisangani in the town of Makiso to demand implementation of the measure.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: A march was organized in Uvira by local civil society groups to show solidarity with the victims of the recent attacks in Beni. Over 100 people dressed in black with "I Beni" signs marched through the main streets of the city.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hundreds of workers of the SOKIMO mining company organized a peaceful march in Watsa to demand 50 months of salary arrears.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Elements)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 days of clashes have been reported between the Bantu and Pgymy (Batwa) communities in the Nyunzu area. At least 2 Batwa and 1 Bantu were allegedly killed, while at least one person was wounded in a machete attack by Elements (Bantu) fighters.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Residents of Panzi Ibanda in Bukavu protested in front of the town hall against shortages of drinking water.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes were reported in the Limete and Kasavubu areas of Lemba district in Kinshasa after demonstrators hostile to the political dialogue started throwing rocks, smashing vehicles' windows and injuring their occupants. Police intervened with tear gas and arrested a dozen of the protesters. The demonstrators also targeted the HQ of the UNC and ATD parties who are participating in the dialogue with rocks and burned tires in front of them. At least one protester was injured and 90 arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Clashes were reported in the Limete and Kasavubu areas of Lemba district in Kinshasa after demonstrators hostile to the political dialogue started throwing rocks, smashing vehicles' windows and injuring their occupants. Police intervened with tear gas and arrested a dozen of the protesters. The demonstrators also targeted the HQ of the UNC and ATD parties who are participating in the dialogue with rocks and burned tires in front of them. At least one protester was injured and 90 arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Elements)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 days of clashes have been reported between the Bantu and Pgymy (Batwa) communities in the Nyunzu area. At least 2 Batwa and 1 Bantu were allegedly killed, while at least one person was wounded in a machete attack by Elements (Bantu) fighters.

properties.ACTOR1: Militia (Elements)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 3 days of clashes have been reported between the Bantu and Pgymy (Batwa) communities in the Nyunzu area. At least 2 Batwa and 1 Bantu were allegedly killed, while at least one person was wounded in a machete attack by Elements (Bantu) fighters.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
properties.ACTOR2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: The military regain control of the Muchacha  mining area in Okapi from Mayi Mayi Simba. A soldier was killed in the battle.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: During an authorized protest march in Bulungu, police fired warning shots to disperse the marchers, leading to clashes. Allegedly as many as 20 police were injured, 9 seriously, after the demonstrators started throwing rocks and then proceeded to burn municipality offices and the local police station.

properties.ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hostilities resumed between the Pygmies and Bantus on September 3 near the city of Nyunzu in the new province of Tanganyika.

properties.ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hostilities resumed between the Pygmies and Bantus since September 3 near the city of Nyunzu in the new province of Tanganyika.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked an army position near Kateku in the Walikale area leading to a clash.

properties.ACTOR1: Mbororo Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Mbororo pastoralists are accused of killing multiple civilians in Haut-Uele.

properties.ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hostilities resumed between the Pygmies and Bantus since September 3 near the city of Nyunzu in the new province of Tanganyika.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: 6 humanitarian workers from the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) were kidnapped in the late afternoon in Mashinga, in Masisi (North Kivu) on their way to a humanitarian mission to Kalembe. Police sources said the kidnappers demanded the payment of a ransom of $1,000 each before their release. Nyatura would be the perpetrators. If the membership of the captors is proved, this kidnapping would be considered a violation of the act of commitment signed in August by Nyatura and APCLS militias to end insecurity.

properties.ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
properties.NOTES: A farmer was killed by Nyatura fighters on Tshangungu hill near Lumbishi in the Kalehe area.

properties.ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 civilians were killed during clashes between Congolese soldiers and Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen in several villages in the Walikale area. The violence was a continuation of clashes between the two groups which started the day before.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Azize Kahindo Balikwisha, head of Isale-Bulombo group in Beni (North Kivu), was killed Tuesday evening by an unidentified armed group.

properties.ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hostilities resumed between the Pygmies and Bantus since September 3 near the city of Nyunzu in the new province of Tanganyika.

properties.ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Hostilities resumed between the Pygmies and Bantus since September 3 near the city of Nyunzu in the new province of Tanganyika.

properties.ACTOR1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: Eight people were killed in clashes between Bantus and Pygmies in the night from Wednesday to Thursday near the city of Nyunzu in the new province of Tanganyika.

properties.ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: On Thursday evening, a young man was killed by unidentified gunmen.

properties.ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ALLY_ACTOR_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
properties.NOTES: UDPS supporters occupy the road outside of the party's headquarters. The police are deployed to monitor the sit-in but no interactions occur.

properties.ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.ACTOR2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.NOTES: 2 people had died Friday in Kasumbalesa town, on the border with Zambia, in clashes between police and angry residents protested on rising insecurity after the murder of a young businessman. Local sources report five people five people had been killed.

properties.ACTOR1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
properties.ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.NOTES: An inspector from the Bunia Military Prosecutor (Ituri), a captain of the sub-police station Mungwalu and a civilian were wounded in an attack on two vehicles by gunmen on September 10 on 'axis Bunia-Mahagi road.
